title: Ipca Laboratories shares rise 2.01% in Tuesday's trading session
content: At 11:39 AM on Tuesday, Ipca Laboratories shares were trading at Rs 1,363.60, a gain of 2.01% in today's session. The stock is trading positively on the NSE. Financial Overview Ipca Laboratories' consolidated financial performance showcases consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily from Rs 5,419.99 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,939.59 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 1,148.84 Crore in 2021 to Rs 787.53 Crore in 2025. The following table presents the key financial figures for Ipca Laboratories over the past five years:YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20215,419.991,148.8445.01371.7924.240.0520225,829.79910.9534.85219.5116.090.1420236,244.32491.9318.58233.168.060.2520247,705.04529.2125.82304.578.640.2220258,939.59787.5335.14273.8810.610.19The revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased by 15.9% compared to the year ending March 2024. Similarly, the net profit increased by 48.8% during the same period. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 25.82 in 2024 to Rs 35.14 in 2025. Quarterly Performance The consolidated quarterly revenue for Ipca Laboratories has also shown a positive trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,308.85 Crore, up from Rs 2,092.63 Crore in June 2024.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20242,092.63198.987.58Sep 20242,354.90245.449.05Dec 20242,245.37277.339.78Mar 20252,246.6965.782.67Jun 20252,308.85234.429.19The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 234.42 Crore, compared to Rs 198.98 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS increased from Rs 7.58 in June 2024 to Rs 9.19 in June 2025. The company’s sales for the year ending March 2025 were Rs 8,939 Crore, compared to Rs 7,705 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s other income for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 92 Crore, compared to Rs 124 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s total income for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 9,032 Crore, compared to Rs 7,829 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s total expenditure for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 7,816 Crore, compared to Rs 6,848 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s EBIT for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,216 Crore, compared to Rs 980 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s interest for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 84 Crore, compared to Rs 138 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The company’s tax for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 343 Crore, compared to Rs 313 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Balance Sheet The total liabilities of the company as of March 2025 are Rs 11,760 Crore compared to Rs 11,101 Crore in March 2024. The total assets of the company as of March 2025 are Rs 11,760 Crore compared to Rs 11,101 Crore in March 2024. Cash Flow Net cash flow as of March 2025 is Rs 168 Crore compared to -Rs 823 Crore in March 2024. Key Ratios The basic EPS as of March 2025 is Rs 35.14 compared to Rs 25.82 in March 2024. The P/E ratio as of March 2025 is 42.74 compared to 47.92 in March 2024. The debt to equity ratio as of March 2025 is 0.19 compared to 0.22 in March 2024. Corporate Actions Ipca Laboratories has announced several corporate actions, including shareholder meetings and financial results announcements. The company declared a final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) on May 29, 2025. A bonus issue of 1:1 was announced on October 27, 2004, with an ex-bonus date of January 28, 2005. Additionally, the company has undergone stock splits, including one on January 10, 2022, where the face value changed from Rs 2 to Rs 1, and another on March 22, 2010, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Ipca Laboratories is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol analysis as of August 5, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. Ipca Laboratories' stock is currently trading positively, with the company demonstrating consistent financial growth and having announced several corporate actions.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall marginally; over 2.6 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,511.40 on the NSE. At 11:20 am, the stock showed a marginal decline of 0.28% from its previous close, with a traded volume of over 2.6 lakh shares. Financial Overview: The following tables provide a concise look at the financial performance of Hindustan Unilever. Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514.00 Crore, compared to Rs 15,670.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 2,769.00 Crore, up from Rs 2,476.00 Crore in the previous quarter. Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased to Rs 63,121.00 Crore from Rs 61,896.00 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 10,679.00 Crore for the year ending March 2025 compared to Rs 10,286.00 Crore for the year ending March 2024. title: ITC shares gain marginally in today's session; over 48.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 417.65 on the NSE, a marginal gain of 0.19% from the previous close at 11:20 am. Over 48.4 lakh shares were traded in today's session. Financial Snapshot The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of ITC:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to 4.19 in June 2025 from 4.08 in June 2024. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of ITC:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly down from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to 27.79 in March 2025 from 16.42 in March 2024. title: Bharti Airtel shares trade marginally down in today's session; over 13.8 lakh shares traded
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading at Rs 1,854.30 on the NSE at 11:20 am, a marginal decline of 0.17% from the previous close. Over 13.8 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. In terms of quarterly results, the consolidated revenue for Bharti Airtel for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.21 in June 2024. title: Petronet LNG shares rise 2.09% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Shares of Petronet LNG were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock price increasing by 2.09% to Rs 278.80. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Overview: Petronet LNG's financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Performance: Key quarterly figures include:Revenue: The company’s revenue has seen fluctuations over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 11,879.86 Crore, compared to Rs 13,415.13 Crore in June 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 824.44 Crore, a decrease from Rs 1,100.76 Crore in June 2024.EPS: Earnings per share stood at Rs 5.61 for the quarter-ending June 2025, down from Rs 7.37 in June 2024.Annual Performance: The annual financial performance shows these trends:Revenue: The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 50,982.03 Crore, slightly lower than Rs 52,729.33 Crore in March 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,883.92 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 3,527.02 Crore in March 2024.EPS: The earnings per share increased from Rs 24.35 in March 2024 to Rs 26.48 in March 2025.BVPS: The Book Value Per Share increased from Rs 116.07 in March 2024 to Rs 132.52 in March 2025.ROE: Return on Equity decreased from 20.97% in March 2024 to 19.98% in March 2025.Debt to Equity: The debt-to-equity ratio remained stable at 0.00 in March 2025.The following tables provide a more detailed look at Petronet LNG's financial performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 13,415.13 CroreRs 13,024.29 CroreRs 12,226.86 CroreRs 12,315.75 CroreRs 11,879.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,100.76 CroreRs 848.99 CroreRs 866.59 CroreRs 1,067.58 CroreRs 824.44 CroreEPS7.375.806.017.305.61Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 26,022.90 CroreRs 43,168.57 CroreRs 59,899.35 CroreRs 52,729.33 CroreRs 50,982.03 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,920.30 CroreRs 3,339.46 CroreRs 3,187.80 CroreRs 3,527.02 CroreRs 3,883.92 CroreEPS19.5922.9222.1724.3526.48BVPS78.7191.12101.76116.07132.52ROE24.8925.1521.7820.9719.98Debt to Equity0.010.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 50,982.03 Crore compared to Rs 52,729.33 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,883.92 Crore compared to Rs 3,527.02 Crore in March 2024. EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was 26.48 compared to 24.35 in March 2024. Corporate Actions: Petronet LNG has been actively communicating with its shareholders and the investor community. Key announcements include:Analyst/Institutional Investor Meet: On August 4, 2025, the company announced the schedule of an analyst meet.Earnings Call Transcript: Also on August 4, 2025, the transcript of the post-result concall held on July 28, 2025, was released.TDS on Final Dividend: On July 30, 2025, an intimation was made regarding the deduction of Tax at Source (TDS) on the final dividend for the financial year 2024-25.In terms of dividends, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 3 per share (30%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Based on Moneycontrol analysis as of today, the sentiment for Petronet LNG is very bearish. Petronet LNG shares were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock price increasing by 2.09% to Rs 278.80.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.68% in today's session; over 10 lakh shares traded
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading with a gain of 0.68% at Rs 3693.40 in Tuesday's session. Over 10 lakh shares were traded as of about 11.20 am. Financial Highlights Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 26.30 in June 2025 from Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 63,678.92 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,325.57 CroreEPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30Consolidated Yearly Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,734.45 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 15,569.72 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 109.36 in March 2025 from Rs 93.96 in March 2024. Key financial ratios include a book value per share (BVPS) of Rs 710.12 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.33 for the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 135,979.03 CroreRs 156,521.23 CroreRs 183,340.70 CroreRs 221,112.91 CroreRs 255,734.45 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,668.96 CroreRs 10,291.05 CroreRs 12,624.87 CroreRs 15,569.72 CroreRs 17,687.39 CroreEPS82.4961.7174.5193.96109.36BVPS625.97678.79736.87746.01710.12ROE15.2610.5211.7215.1215.39Debt to Equity1.731.501.331.321.33The annual income statement shows consistent growth. Sales have steadily increased from Rs 135,979 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,734 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, net profit has risen from Rs 4,668 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 17,687 Crore in March 2025. Corporate Actions Larsen & Toubro announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share (1700%) with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Other recent corporate actions include:August 11, 2025: L&T secured a contract from Adani Power for 6,400MW Thermal Power for CarbonLite Solutions Business.August 6, 2025: Clarification on news item appearing in Media / Publication.The company has also announced several bonus issues in the past, with the most recent being on May 29, 2017, with a bonus ratio of 1:2 and an ex-bonus date of July 13, 2017. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3693.40, Larsen & Toubro shows positive momentum in today's session, supported by strong financial performance and strategic contract wins.

title: Adani Total Gas shares rise 2.01% in Tuesday's trading session
content: Shares of Adani Total Gas were trading higher at Rs 608.30 in Tuesday's session as of 11.26 am, a gain of 2.01% from the previous close. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Overview: Adani Total Gas's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,999.86 Crore, up from Rs 4,474.74 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 639.38 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 649.60 Crore recorded in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5.95, compared to Rs 6.07 in March 2024. The company’s consolidated quarterly revenue also reflects this upward trajectory. In the quarter ending June 2025, the revenue was Rs 1,378.58 Crore, an increase from Rs 1,341.26 Crore in the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 161.03 Crore, up from Rs 148.40 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 1.50, compared to Rs 1.41 in the quarter ending March 2025. Other income increased from Rs 44 Crore to Rs 30 Crore during the same period. Total income reached Rs 5,030 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 4,518 Crore in March 2024. Expenditure also increased, totaling Rs 4,070 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 3,528 Crore in the previous year. EBIT was reported at Rs 960 Crore, compared to Rs 989 Crore in the corresponding period. Interest paid amounted to Rs 100 Crore, down from Rs 111 Crore. The net profit was Rs 639 Crore, while it was Rs 649 Crore in the previous year. EBIT increased to Rs 245 Crore, up from Rs 221 Crore. Interest increased to Rs 27 Crore, up from Rs 23 Crore. Net profit was Rs 161 Crore, while it was Rs 148 Crore in the previous quarter. title: SJVN, Biocon stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 11:30 am on Tuesday, SJVN and Biocon stocks were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. SJVN's shares rose 5.17 percent, while Biocon's shares gained 3.48 percent. Other notable gainers included Hitachi Energy, Jindal Stainless, and Petronet LNG. SJVN Financial Highlights: SJVN's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 917.45 Crore, compared to Rs 504.40 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 870.37 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 236.89 Crore, compared to a net loss of Rs 130.36 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and a net profit of Rs 356.19 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.58, compared to Rs -0.32 for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 0.91 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 2,485.39 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,072.01 Crore in 2025. The net profit decreased from Rs 1,641.78 Crore in 2021 to Rs 812.32 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the EPS decreased from Rs 4.19 in 2021 to Rs 2.08 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 32.55 in 2021 to Rs 36.08 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) decreased from 12.86 percent in 2021 to 5.78 percent in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.15 in 2021 to 1.90 in 2025. Biocon Financial Highlights: Biocon's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,941.90 Crore, compared to Rs 4,417.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 3,432.90 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 89.20 Crore, compared to Rs 459.40 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 861.80 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.26, compared to Rs 2.88 for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 5.51 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 7,105.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 15,261.70 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 925.40 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,429.40 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 6.24 in 2021 to Rs 8.46 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 70.09 in 2021 to Rs 180.27 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) decreased from 9.83 percent in 2021 to 4.68 percent in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.47 in 2021 to 0.82 in 2025. Hitachi Energy Financial Highlights: Hitachi Energy's standalone yearly revenue increased from Rs 3,420 Crore in December 2020 to Rs 6,384 Crore in March 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 99 Crore in December 2020 to Rs 383 Crore in March 2025. Jindal Stainless Financial Highlights: Jindal Stainless' consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 12,188.46 Crore in 2021 to Rs 39,312.21 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 414.25 Crore in 2021 to Rs 2,543.42 Crore in 2025. Petronet LNG Financial Highlights: Petronet LNG's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 26,022.90 Crore in 2021 to Rs 50,982.03 Crore in 2025. The net profit increased from Rs 2,920.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,883.92 Crore in 2025. Corporate Actions SJVN announced Interim dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-02-13, effective date as 21 Feb, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.1.15. Also, announce date as 2024-05-29, effective date as 12 Sep, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.0.65. Biocon announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-08, effective date as 04 Jul, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.0.50. Also, announce date as 2024-05-16, effective date as 05 Jul, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.0.50. Hitachi Energy announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-14, effective date as 13 Aug, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.6.00. Also, announce date as 2024-05-21, effective date as 14 Aug, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.4.00. Jindal Stainles announced Interim dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-01-29, effective date as 07 Feb, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.1.00. Also, announce date as 2024-05-15, effective date as 30 Aug, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.2.00. Petronet LNG announced Final dividends. Key dates include announce date as 2025-05-19, effective date as 04 Jul, 2025 with dividend amount of Rs.3.00. Also, announce date as 2024-10-24, effective date as 08 Nov, 2024 with dividend amount of Rs.7.00. Petronet LNG also had bonus issue on 09 May, 2017 in the ratio of 1:1.

title: NSDL shares edge higher ahead of first Q1 results since market debut
content: Shares of National Securities Depository Ltd. (NSDL) swung sharply on Tuesday, August 12 — rising up to 5 percent in early trade before paring almost all gains — as investors awaited the depository’s first quarterly results since its market debut, amid a broader decline in Indian equities. The stock had a volatile start to the week. On Monday, it briefly touched an intraday high of Rs 1,425, nearly 80 percent above its IPO price of Rs 800, before giving up gains and ending the session over 12 percent lower from the day’s peak. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Rival Central Depository Services (India) Ltd. (CDSL) recently reported a 15.3 percent sequential rise in revenue and an improvement in margins for the June quarter. However, the number of new demat accounts opened during the period dropped 11 percent both sequentially and year-on-year, even as demat custody value grew compared to the previous quarter. Since listing, NSDL shares have rallied sharply, pushing valuations above those of CDSL — a reversal from the discount they traded at prior to debut. The company entered the market on August 6 at Rs 880 on the BSE, a 10 percent premium to its issue price. The debut premium was lower than grey market expectations, though analysts have largely maintained a long-term bullish view on the stock, citing NSDL’s dominant position in the depository business. Also read: We've strengthened the team and have a more diversified portfolio, says Axis AMC's B Gopkumar At present, NSDL trades at a price-to-earnings multiple of about 79, compared to CDSL’s roughly 66. By around 11 am, NSDL shares were trading at Rs 1,290 on the NSE, up 1.4 percent from the previous close, with about 1 crore shares changing hands — sharply lower than the 5 crore shares traded yesterday. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Shares of National Securities Depository Ltd. (NSDL) swung sharply on Tuesday, August 12 — rising up to 5 percent in early trade before paring almost all gains — as investors awaited the depository’s first quarterly results since its market debut, amid a broader decline in Indian equities.
summary_luhn: By around 11 am, NSDL shares were trading at Rs 1,290 on the NSE, up 1.4 percent from the previous close, with about 1 crore shares changing hands — sharply lower than the 5 crore shares traded yesterday.

title: SJVN shares surge 5% on steady Q1 revenue, strong margins
content: Shares of SJVN climbed 5 percent to Rs 98 apiece on August 12 after the state-run hydropower producer reported stable sales and operational results for the June quarter (Q1FY26). So far in 2025, the stock has declined 12 percent, underperforming the benchmark Nifty 50’s 2 percent rise over the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 2025, SJVN’s consolidated net profit fell 36.2 percent year-on-year to Rs 227.8 crore. This decline came despite growth in revenue and an improvement in profit margins. Revenue from operations increased 5.4 percent to Rs 917.5 crore from Rs 870.4 crore in the same period last year, while operating profit (EBITDA) rose 11.2 percent to Rs 742.4 crore. Operating margin improved to 80.9 percent from 76.7 percent in Q1FY25, supported by higher efficiency in the generation business. The renewable energy segment, which includes wind and solar power, contributed Rs 115.62 crore to revenue in Q1FY26, more than doubling from Rs 55.83 crore a year earlier. Revenue from power trading, however, fell to Rs 0.78 crore from Rs 1.94 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Other income during the quarter dropped to Rs 54.14 crore from Rs 88.10 crore in the year-ago period, with the bulk coming from bank interest and late payment surcharges from beneficiaries. On the policy side, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has directed public sector power companies — including SJVN, NTPC, NHPC, and Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) — to amend their renewable energy tenders to mandate the use of Indian-made solar cells. These PSUs also act as renewable energy implementing agencies (REIAs) as part of India’s plan to achieve 500 GW of non-fossil fuel power capacity by 2030. According to a senior MNRE official, the requirement will take effect 30 days after the ministry publishes “List II” of approved modules and manufacturers, specifically for solar cells. The list is expected next month, meaning tenders floated from October onward will be required to use Indian-made solar cells. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Revenue from operations increased 5.4 percent to Rs 917.5 crore from Rs 870.4 crore in the same period last year, while operating profit (EBITDA) rose 11.2 percent to Rs 742.4 crore.
summary_luhn: On the policy side, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has directed public sector power companies — including SJVN, NTPC, NHPC, and Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) — to amend their renewable energy tenders to mandate the use of Indian-made solar cells.
summary_lsa: The list is expected next month, meaning tenders floated from October onward will be required to use Indian-made solar cells.

title: Tube Investments of India shares rise 0.91% amid high volume in today's session
content: Tube Investments of India Ltd shares are trading at Rs 3,028 in today's session, up by 0.91%. The stock experienced high volume and a surge in trading activity, showing positive momentum at 10:13 am. Financial Performance: Tube Investments of India Ltd.'s financial performance demonstrates growth in revenue over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue increased from Rs 6,083.29 Crore in 2021 to Rs 19,464.65 Crore in 2025. Net profit reached Rs 1,054.67 Crore in 2025, compared to Rs 304.69 Crore in 2021. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 34.83 in 2025, compared to Rs 15.13 in 2021. The quarterly financial results also indicate a solid performance. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,309.06 Crore, compared to Rs 4,577.92 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 303.28 Crore, while it was Rs 313.80 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 10.28, compared to Rs 11.64 for the quarter-ending June 2024. title: KEI Industries shares fall 2.07% in morning trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KEI Industries declined 2.07% to Rs 3,731.60 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock's movement reflected a decrease from its previous close. title: MphasiS shares rise 2.13% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of MphasiS gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 2,729.00 on Tuesday. The stock is featured on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Highlights Consolidated Financial Performance: MphasiS has demonstrated consistent financial performance across key metrics. Here’s a detailed look at the company’s consolidated financials: Revenue: The company's revenue has shown steady growth, with quarterly revenue increasing from Rs 3,422.46 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 3,732.49 Crore in June 2025. Annually, the revenue increased from Rs 13,278.52 Crore in 2024 to Rs 14,229.99 Crore in 2025. Net Profit: Net profit has also seen a rise, with quarterly profits increasing from Rs 404.51 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 441.70 Crore in June 2025. The annual net profit increased from Rs 1,554.82 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,702.14 Crore in 2025. Earnings Per Share (EPS): The EPS has grown, with quarterly EPS increasing from Rs 21.40 in June 2024 to Rs 23.22 in June 2025. The annual EPS increased from Rs 82.42 in 2024 to Rs 89.87 in 2025. Key Financial Ratios: MphasiS demonstrates strong financial health through key ratios. title: Persistent Systems shares rise 2.14% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Persistent Systems were trading higher at Rs 5,281.50, marking a gain of 2.14% in today's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, Persistent Systems has demonstrated robust growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,333.59 Crore, up from Rs 3,242.11 Crore in the previous quarter. Net profit for the same period was Rs 424.94 Crore, compared to Rs 395.76 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 25.64 to Rs 27.43 for the respective quarters. The annual consolidated revenue has shown a consistent increase over the years. For the year 2025, the revenue was Rs 11,938.72 Crore, a notable rise from Rs 9,821.59 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year 2025 was Rs 1,400.16 Crore, compared to Rs 1,093.49 Crore in 2024. The EPS also rose to Rs 91.22 in 2025 from Rs 72.44 in the previous year. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 20 per share (400%) was declared, effective from January 31, 2025. Recently, the company has had several investor/analyst meet sessions on August 11, 2025, and August 8, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 5,281.50, Persistent Systems has demonstrated a notable upward movement in today's session.

title: Coforge shares rise 2.06% in morning trade on Nifty Midcap 150
content: COFORGE LIMITED shares gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 1,647.10 in Tuesday's session. The stock movement reflects a positive investor activity during morning trade. The stock is included in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On August 8, 2025, the company announced a general update. Furthermore, the company intimated the filing of Scheme of Amalgamation Application with the Hon'ble National Company Law Tribunal on August 7, 2025. Additionally, the company announced the resignation of Mr. Gautam Samanta as President & Executive Director of the Company w.e.f. October 10, 2025 on August 1, 2025. title: Grasim share price falls 1.43%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Grasim declined 1.43% to trade at Rs 2,719.50 in Tuesday's trading session at 10:00 am, making it among the top losers on the Nifty 50. The stock's performance reflects a negative trend from its previous close. title: Newly-listed Travel Food Services, Belrise Industries shares surge up to 4% after strong Q1 results, Scoda Tubes down 2%
content: The shares of Travel Food Services and Belrise Industries recorded notable gains on August 12 after the two companies announced strong earnings for the April-June quarter of FY26. Scoda Tubes shares meanwhile dropped in trade. The three companies recently debuted on the stock markets after successfully raising funds through IPO. Travel Food Services: Travel Food Services shares surged more than 4 percent after the company reported a net profit of Rs 91.77 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a 66 percent on-year jump from the Rs 55.42 crore net profit reported in Q1 FY25. The firm's revenue from operations meanwhile fell nearly 8.5 percent YoY to Rs 375 crore. The shares of the company had made a tepid market debut on the stock exchanges in July, listing at a premium of just over 2 percent against the IPO price at Rs 1,125 apiece. The shares of the company are currently trading at Rs 1,129 apiece. This means that despite today’s sharp rise, the stock has only made marginal gains overall so far. Belrise Industries: Belrise Industries on August 12 reported a net profit of Rs 111.68 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a 56 percent on-year jump from the Rs 71.56 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile rose more than 27 percent on-year to Rs 2,262.2 crore during the quarter under review. The shares of the company had made a decent debut on stock markets in May, listing at 11 percent premium to IPO price at Rs 100 per share. After the release of the results, the shares of the company jumped nearly 3 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 137 apiece. This marks a 37 percent surge from the listing price. The shares later pared some gains to trade 0.5 percent higher at Rs 134 apiece. Jefferies has kept a ‘Buy’ call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 135 apiece. This implies a limited upside potential of nearly 1.3 percent over the previous closing price of Rs 133.31 apiece. Scoda Tubes: Scoda Tubes on August 11 reported a 48 percent on-year jump in net profit to Rs 7.08 crore in Q1 FY26 from the Rs 4.79 crore in Q1 FY25. The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile grew 6 percent on-year to Rs 97 crore. Scoda Tubes had made a muted market debut in June, listing with zero premium over IPO price at Rs 140 per share. After the release of the results, Scoda Tubes shares dropped nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 183 apiece. The stock has so far gained 31 percent from its listing price. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The shares of the company had made a tepid market debut on the stock exchanges in July, listing at a premium of just over 2 percent against the IPO price at Rs 1,125 apiece.

summary_lsa: Scoda Tubes had made a muted market debut in June, listing with zero premium over IPO price at Rs 140 per share.

Additionally, the company announced newspaper publication relating to IEPF on July 31, 2025. The company also announced receipt of order for supply of one of the ATGM from M/s. Armoured Vehicles Nigam Limited on July 25, 2025. The company has announced several dividends in the past, including an interim dividend of Rs.4.00 per share (80%) with an effective date of February 14, 2025. Bharat Dynamics had a stock split, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 5. The ex-split date was May 24, 2024. According to a Moneycontrol analysis as of August 8, 2025, the sentiment for Bharat Dynamics is bearish.

title: Astral Ltd shares fall 5.47%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Astral Ltd declined 5.47% to Rs 1,306.00 in early trade on Tuesday, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Other notable losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 included GlaxoSmithKline, BSE Limited, Supreme Ind, and Mazagon Dock. Astral Ltd's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,361.20 Crore, compared to Rs 1,383.60 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 79.20 Crore, down from Rs 119.50 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) decreased to Rs 3.02 from Rs 4.48. Here's a summary of Astral Ltd's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,383.60 CroreRs 1,370.40 CroreRs 1,397.00 CroreRs 1,681.40 CroreRs 1,361.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 119.50 CroreRs 108.70 CroreRs 112.70 CroreRs 178.00 CroreRs 79.20 CroreEPS4.484.104.256.673.02 The company's annual financial performance provides further insights. Consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 5,832.40 Crore, an increase from Rs 5,641.40 Crore in March 2024. However, net profit saw a slight decrease from Rs 545.70 Crore in 2024 to Rs 518.90 Crore in 2025. The EPS also saw a decrease from Rs 20.33 to Rs 19.50. Key annual financial indicators are presented below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,176.30 CroreRs 4,394.00 CroreRs 5,158.50 CroreRs 5,641.40 CroreRs 5,832.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 415.20 CroreRs 492.30 CroreRs 461.00 CroreRs 545.70 CroreRs 518.90 CroreEPS20.1324.0817.0020.3319.50BVPS95.31117.57109.95121.46134.46ROE21.3420.7116.8417.1314.48Debt to Equity0.020.040.030.030.04 Furthermore, a detailed look into the annual income statement reveals the following (all figures in Crore):Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales5,8325,6415,1584,3943,176Other Income4142263425Total Income5,8735,6835,1854,4283,201Total Expenditure5,1294,9204,5283,7652,648EBIT743762656663553Interest4129401213Tax183188155158124Net Profit518545461492415 Cash flow data indicates the following (all figures in Crore):Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Operating Activities629823556543664Investing Activities-512-541-47971-454Financing Activities-118-202-190-44-153Others00100Net Cash Flow-179-11157056 The balance sheet provides the following data (all figures in Crore):Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Share Capital2626262020Reserves & Surplus3,5903,1592,6822,3151,875Current Liabilities1,1431,1211,333940688Other Liabilities29519033011089Total Liabilities5,0564,4974,3733,3872,672Fixed Assets2,5132,1361,7641,3621,114Current Assets2,1481,9852,2491,7451,269Other Assets394375359279289Total Assets5,0564,4974,3733,3872,672Contingent Liabilities0368183213246 Key financial ratios for Astral Ltd as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 19.50, a book value per share of Rs 134.46, and a return on equity of 14.48%. The debt to equity ratio is 0.04. As of March 2025, the P/E ratio was 66.37 and the P/B ratio was 9.62. The company has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (225%) was announced on May 21, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) on October 31, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (225%) on May 17, 2024. Astral Ltd has also issued bonus shares in the past. A bonus ratio of 1:3 was announced on February 7, 2023, with a record date of March 14, 2023. Another bonus ratio of 1:3 was announced on February 3, 2021, with a record date of March 19, 2021. The company has also undergone stock splits. A split was announced on May 3, 2014, with the old face value of Rs 2 being split into a new face value of Rs 1. Another split was announced on May 20, 2013, with the old face value of Rs 5 being split into a new face value of Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment for Astral Ltd as of August 12, 2025.

title: Hyundai Motor shares rally 3% as Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with buy rating
content: Shares of Hyundai Motor India Ltd. gained as much as 3 percent to Rs 2,222 in morning deals on August 12, extending gains for a second consecutive session after Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a buy recommendation, citing positive factors for growth. The international brokerage has set a price target of Rs 2,600 per share, implying an upside potential of 21 percent from the last close on the NSE. Goldman Sachs stated that the company has a strong positioning to outpace its peers, particularly in FY27–FY28. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The brokerage expects growth to be driven by successful EV models, market share gains in emerging markets, and upcoming product launches, which could lift market share by 120 basis points between FY25 and FY28. Hyundai is projected to post over 8 percent volume CAGR over the next three years, compared to the domestic car industry’s 5.3 percent. While near-term startup costs are anticipated, Goldman Sachs believes they will be offset by an improved SUV and export mix, with the company also well-placed to benefit from a potential domestic car market upcycle in FY27. In the first quarter, Hyundai Motor India reported an 8.08 percent year-on-year drop in consolidated net profit to Rs 1,369.23 crore, weighed down by weak domestic sales. In the year-ago period, net profit stood at Rs 1,489.65 crore. Revenue from operations declined 5.37 percent to Rs 16,412.87 crore from Rs 17,344.23 crore in Q1 FY25. EBITDA fell 6.63 percent year-on-year to Rs 2,185.2 crore, while the operating margin narrowed by 20 basis points to 13.3 percent. Also read: US tariffs on India’s oil imports a ‘big blow’ to Moscow, says Trump Domestic volumes contracted 11.5 percent to 1,32,259 units, but exports grew 13 percent to 48,140 units, partially cushioning the impact. Overall volumes slipped 6.1 percent to 1,80,399 units. The Creta remained Hyundai’s top-selling SUV in the quarter with 47,662 units, followed by the Venue at 22,331 units and the Exter at 17,188 units. The company’s portfolio includes 12 ICE models — such as the Grand i10 Nios, Verna, Creta and Alcazar — and two EVs, the Creta Electric and Ioniq 5. At about 9:40 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 2,196, higher by 2.1 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hyundai Motor India shares have risen nearly 20 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sun TV Network shares rise 2.30% in early trade
content: Sun TV Network shares showed a positive movement in Tuesday's early trading session, with the stock price increasing by 2.30% to Rs 580.95. At 09:32 am, the stock demonstrated an upward trend, reflecting a positive start to the trading day. In terms of quarterly financial performance, Sun TV Network reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 1,290.28 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025, compared to Rs 940.59 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 531.94 Crore, while the earnings per share (EPS) was Rs 13.43. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance of Sun TV Network:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,312.40 CroreRs 934.54 CroreRs 827.56 CroreRs 940.59 CroreRs 1,290.28 CroreNet ProfitRs 557.19 CroreRs 408.64 CroreRs 356.94 CroreRs 386.13 CroreRs 531.94 CroreEPS14.2010.399.229.4313.43The company's annual financial performance provides a broader perspective. For the year ending March 2025, Sun TV Network reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 4,015.09 Crore, a decrease compared to the Rs 4,282.10 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,708.54 Crore, a decrease from the Rs 1,915.53 Crore reported in the previous year. The annual EPS stood at Rs 43.23. The following table summarizes the yearly financial performance of Sun TV Network:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,176.89 CroreRs 3,584.82 CroreRs 3,772.05 CroreRs 4,282.10 CroreRs 4,015.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,531.66 CroreRs 1,650.62 CroreRs 1,703.38 CroreRs 1,915.53 CroreRs 1,708.54 CroreEPS38.7041.6643.3148.8643.23BVPS179.12207.07235.41267.52295.56ROE21.6220.1318.4018.2714.62Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Sun TV Network's board has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (100%) was announced on August 5, 2025, with an effective date of August 13, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) was announced on March 7, 2025, and February 5, 2025, effective from March 13, 2025, and February 13, 2025, respectively. Additionally, the company announced in its exchange filing regarding update to the disclosure made on 20th June, 2025. Sun TV Network is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 09:33 am, Sun TV Network shares were trading at Rs 580.95, marking a 2.30% increase in the early trading session.

title: Siemens shares rise 2.06% in early trade
content: Shares of Siemens gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 3,178.90 in Tuesday's session. At 9:27 am, the stock demonstrated positive movement, with investors closely monitoring the stock's performance on the NIFTY NEXT 50. Siemens' consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,346.80 Crore, compared to Rs 5,203.50 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 423.40 Crore in June 2025, down from Rs 578.10 Crore in June 2024. The earnings per share (EPS) also decreased from Rs 16.24 in June 2024 to Rs 11.89 in June 2025. Here's a summary of the company's quarterly financial performance:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 5,203.50 CroreRs 6,461.10 CroreRs 3,587.20 CroreRs 4,259.00 CroreRs 4,346.80 CroreNet ProfitRs 578.10 CroreRs 831.20 CroreRs 614.60 CroreRs 582.50 CroreRs 423.40 CroreEPS16.2423.3517.2616.3611.89The company's annual financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue increased from Rs 9,946.50 Crore in 2020 to Rs 22,239.70 Crore in 2024. Net profit also rose from Rs 769.50 Crore in 2020 to Rs 2,718.10 Crore in 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) grew from Rs 21.59 in 2020 to Rs 76.33 in 2024. The company has declared several dividends, including a final dividend of Rs 12 per share (600%) announced on November 26, 2024, with an effective date of January 30, 2025. title: HDFC Bank share price falls 0.54% in early trade
content: Shares of HDFC Bank were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,984.80 on the NSE. At 09:20 am, the stock showed a decline of 0.54% from the previous close. HDFC Bank's revenue has shown steady growth over the last five quarters. The yearly data shows a consistent increase in revenue and net profit. HDFC Bank announced a bonus issue of 1:1, with the ex-bonus date fixed as August 26, 2025. The company also announced a special dividend of Rs 5 per share on July 21, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. Additionally, a final dividend of Rs 22 per share was announced on April 21, 2025, effective from June 27, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis from August 5, 2025, indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock.

title: ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank among top negative contributors on Nifty 50 in early trading today
content: During Tuesday's session at 9:25 am, several stocks were identified as negative contributors to the Nifty 50 index. ICICI Bank led the decline, followed by HDFC Bank, Grasim, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. ICICI Bank Financial Overview ICICI Bank's financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The income statement for ICICI Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned annually, rising from Rs 89,162 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 186,331 Crore in March 2025. Other income also increased, contributing to a total income of Rs 294,586 Crore by March 2025. Total expenditure has similarly increased, but operating profit has consistently grown, reaching Rs 77,789 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has shown a strong upward trend, reaching Rs 54,449 Crore by March 2025, reflecting efficient financial management. The quarterly income statement data shows a consistent increase in interest earned, rising from Rs 44,581 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,079 Crore in June 2025. Other income has also increased, contributing to a total income of Rs 74,576 Crore by June 2025. Total expenditure has similarly increased, but operating profit has remained robust, reaching Rs 21,316 Crore in June 2025. Net profit has shown a strong upward trend, reaching Rs 14,393 Crore by June 2025, reflecting efficient financial management. HDFC Bank Financial Overview HDFC Bank's financial performance demonstrates substantial growth. The income statement for HDFC Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned annually, rising from Rs 128,552 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 336,367 Crore in March 2025. Other income also increased, contributing to a total income of Rs 470,915 Crore by March 2025. Total expenditure has similarly increased, and operating profit has consistently grown, reaching Rs 110,416 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has shown a strong upward trend, reaching Rs 73,440 Crore by March 2025, reflecting efficient financial management. Corporate Actions ICICI Bank announced a final dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (550%) on April 21, 2025, with an effective date of August 12, 2025. Historically, ICICI Bank has also announced a bonus issue, with an announcement date of May 3, 2017, and a bonus ratio of 1:10. HDFC Bank announced a special dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (500%) on July 21, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (2200%) was announced on April 21, 2025, with an effective date of June 27, 2025. HDFC Bank also announced a bonus issue on July 19, 2025, with a bonus ratio of 1:1, and an ex-bonus date of August 26, 2025. ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank were identified as key contributors to the Nifty 50's negative performance during this morning's trading session.

title: Markets rise for 2nd day: Sensex up 400 pts, Nifty above 24,700 as IT, auto stocks lead gains
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex kickstarted the session on a positive note and extended gains for a second session on Tuesday, August 12, as IT, auto and metal stocks lifted sentiment in the opening trade. The broader market, represented by the mid and smallcap indices, also mirrored positive trends to edge higher. At 10 am, the Sensex was up 390.99 points or 0.49 percent at 80,995.07, and the Nifty was up 116.60 points or 0.47 percent at 24,701.65. About 2197 shares advanced, 1021 shares declined, and 120 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Sectoral indices were mostly in the green in early trade, with Nifty IT leading the gains, up 1.50 percent, followed by Nifty Media rising 1.20 percent, Nifty Auto up 0.96 percent, and Nifty Oil & Gas up 0.87 percent. Nifty Energy, Nifty Metal, Nifty Infra, and Nifty Midcap 100 also posted moderate gains. Nifty Bank edged up 0.08 percent, while Nifty Private Bank and Nifty FMCG saw small advances. Nifty Realty was the only major laggard, slipping 0.90 percent. Volatility remained subdued, with India VIX down 0.16 percent at 12.20. Among individual stocks, Hyundai Motor India Ltd gained as much as 3 percent after Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a buy call, citing positive levelers for growth. The international brokerage has set a price target of Rs 2,600 per share, implying an upside potential of 21 percent from the last close on the NSE. Goldman Sachs said the company has strong positioning to outpace peers, particularly in FY27–FY28. Medi Assist Healthcare Services shares surged as much as 5 percent after the large deal involving shares worth Rs 578 crore took place in the block deal window. The firm witnessed a large trade in which 1.10 crore shares, representing 15.67 percent equity, changed hands for Rs 578 crore at Rs 523 per share in the block deal window. Earlier, reports had suggested that the promoter entity Bessemer India would clean out its stake in firm. Shares of Bata India declined 3 percent to Rs 1,152 on August 12 after the footwear maker posted a lacklustre performance for the June quarter (Q1FY26). For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, consolidated net profit plunged 70 percent year-on-year to Rs 52 crore, dragged down by higher expenses, muted consumer demand, and an unfavourable high base effect. In the same quarter last fiscal, the company had reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 174 crore. Technical View Nifty, after slipping to a low of 24,350 in the previous session, staged a strong rebound to close near the 24,600 mark, easing sentiment to some extent. A decisive move above 24,630 would be needed to strengthen the bias, while immediate support lies at 24,300. Sustaining this level could pave the way for further gains in the coming sessions. Bank Nifty also recovered, taking support at its 100-EMA level of 54,950. The index faces stiff resistance around 56,000, with crucial support at 54,900. For the day, Nifty is expected to trade in the 24,400–24,800 range, while Bank Nifty’s range is seen between 54,800 and 56,200. Tata Steel, Hero MotoCorp, Titan Company, Tech Mahindra, TCS and Reliance Industries were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Bajaj Finance, Dr Reddy's, Grasim, Eternal, Hindalco, and Adani Enterprises. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Bank Nifty also recovered, taking support at its 100-EMA level of 54,950.
summary_luhn: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex kickstarted the session on a positive note and extended gains for a second session on Tuesday, August 12, as IT, auto and metal stocks lifted sentiment in the opening trade.
summary_lsa: For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, consolidated net profit plunged 70 percent year-on-year to Rs 52 crore, dragged down by higher expenses, muted consumer demand, and an unfavourable high base effect.
summary_textrank: Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Sectoral indices were mostly in the green in early trade, with Nifty IT leading the gains, up 1.50 percent, followed by Nifty Media rising 1.20 percent, Nifty Auto up 0.96 percent, and Nifty Oil & Gas up 0.87 percent.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares trading flat in early session
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,519.60 on the NSE, up by 0.05% in early trade. Financial Snapshot: Hindustan Unilever's financial performance shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, up from Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769 Crore, compared to Rs 2,614 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 11.11 to Rs 11.73. Here’s a detailed look at the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The company's annual performance also reflects sustained growth. Revenue increased from Rs 61,896 Crore in 2024 to Rs 63,121 Crore in 2025. Net profit rose from Rs 10,286 Crore to Rs 10,679 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 43.74 to Rs 45.32. Below is a summary of the yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 63,121 Crore, other income of Rs 1,017 Crore, and total income of Rs 64,138 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 49,320 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 14,818 Crore. After accounting for interest and taxes, the net profit stood at Rs 10,679 Crore. Hindustan Unilever has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share was announced on April 24, 2025, and was effective from June 23, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share were announced on October 10 and October 11, 2024, respectively, both effective from November 6, 2024. Hindustan Unilever has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent being on September 30, 1991, in the ratio of 1:2. A stock split occurred on July 5, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 8, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading marginally higher, Hindustan Unilever continues to be a key player in the Nifty 50 index.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise 0.80% in early trade

title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise 0.42% in early trade
content: Larsen & Toubro's stock is currently trading at Rs 3,683.80, marking a 0.42% increase from its previous close. This movement comes as the market opens on Tuesday, August 12, 2025, with investors closely monitoring the infrastructure and engineering giant. Financial Overview The following tables provide a consolidated financial overview of Larsen & Toubro, including quarterly and yearly performance metrics. Further dividends were announced on May 8, 2024, of Rs 28 per share, and on May 10 and July 20, 2023, dividends of Rs 24 and Rs 6 per share, respectively. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,683.80, Larsen & Toubro is showing a positive trend in early trade.

title: Astral Limited shares fall 4.26% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Astral Limited experienced a significant decline in Tuesday's early trading session. At 9:16 am, the price of the stock dropped by 4.26% to Rs 1,322.80. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Astral Limited's financial performance reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue and net profit figures are as follows:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,383.60 CroreRs 1,370.40 CroreRs 1,397.00 CroreRs 1,681.40 CroreRs 1,361.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 119.50 CroreRs 108.70 CroreRs 112.70 CroreRs 178.00 CroreRs 79.20 CroreEPS4.484.104.256.673.02Revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 1,681.40 Crore, compared to Rs 1,383.60 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. Net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 178.00 Crore, while for the quarter ending June 2025, it was Rs 79.20 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter ending March 2025 was 6.67, and for the quarter ending June 2025, it was 3.02. Consolidated Yearly Results: The company's consolidated yearly revenue, net profit, and EPS are as follows:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,176.30 CroreRs 4,394.00 CroreRs 5,158.50 CroreRs 5,641.40 CroreRs 5,832.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 415.20 CroreRs 492.30 CroreRs 461.00 CroreRs 545.70 CroreRs 518.90 CroreEPS20.1324.0817.0020.3319.50BVPS95.31117.57109.95121.46134.46ROE21.3420.7116.8417.1314.48Debt to Equity0.020.040.030.030.04The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 5,832.40 Crore, up from Rs 5,641.40 Crore in the year ending March 2024. Net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 518.90 Crore, compared to Rs 545.70 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The earnings per share (EPS) decreased from 20.33 in March 2024 to 19.50 in March 2025. announced several corporate actions, including dividends, bonus issues, and stock splits. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share on May 21, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. The company also announced acquisition and press release under Regulation 30 (LODR) and Financial Result For The Quarter Ended On 30Th June, 2025. Additionally, the company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:3 bonus ratio announced on February 7, 2023, with an ex-bonus date of March 14, 2023. Astral Limited has also undergone stock splits, including a split from a face value of Rs 2 to Rs 1 announced on May 3, 2014, with an ex-split date of September 25, 2014. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,322.80, Astral Limited has experienced a notable downturn in today's session, reflecting the bearish market sentiment.

title: Hyundai Motor India shares rise 2.77% in early trade
content: Shares of Hyundai Motor India gained 2.77% to trade at Rs 2,211.40 in Tuesday's session. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. This early morning movement reflects positive investor activity. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at Hyundai Motor India's key financial performance indicators: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 17,344.23 CroreRs 17,260.38 CroreRs 16,647.99 CroreRs 17,940.28 CroreRs 16,412.88 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,489.65 CroreRs 1,375.47 CroreRs 1,160.73 CroreRs 1,614.35 CroreRs 1,369.23 CroreEPS18.3316.9314.2919.8716.85The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 17,940.28 Crore, compared to Rs 17,344.23 Crore in June 2024. title: Fortis Healthcare shares hit all-time high on BSE
content: Fortis Healthcare shares hit an new all-time high of Rs 927.75 on the BSE in Tuesday's opening trade, climbing as much as 0.75%. Financial Performance: Fortis Healthcare has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the recent years. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,166.72 Crore, compared to Rs 1,858.90 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 263.86 Crore, up from Rs 173.39 Crore in the previous year. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) increased to Rs 3.45 in June 2025 from Rs 2.20 in June 2024. Here's a detailed look at the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,858.90 CroreRs 1,988.39 CroreRs 1,928.26 CroreRs 2,007.20 CroreRs 2,166.72 CroreNet ProfitRs 173.39 CroreRs 188.85 CroreRs 252.24 CroreRs 183.38 CroreRs 263.86 CroreEPS2.202.343.282.443.45The company's annual financial performance also shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,782.75 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 6,892.92 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 797.86 Crore, compared to Rs 635.71 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 10.26 in March 2025 from Rs 7.93 in March 2024. title: Tilaknagar Industries shares jump over 8% as profit more than doubles in Q1FY26
content: Shares of Tilaknagar Industries jumped 8.4 percent to Rs 511 on August 12 after the liquor maker delivered an impressive performance across all key metrics in the June quarter (Q1FY26). So far in 2025, the stock has gained 12 percent, outpacing the benchmark Nifty 50’s 2 percent rise during the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, net profit surged 121.25 percent year-on-year to Rs 88.5 crore, compared with Rs 40 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations jumped 30.7 percent to Rs 409 crore from Rs 313 crore a year earlier. At the operating level, EBITDA rose 89 percent to Rs 94.5 crore in Q1FY26, against Rs 50 crore in the same quarter last year. The EBITDA margin expanded by 700 basis points to 23.1 percent, up from 16 percent in Q1FY25. The company’s board has also approved a capital expenditure of Rs 25 crore for its wholly-owned subsidiary, Prag Distillery (P) , to expand its existing bottling capacity. The project will raise Prag’s current capacity from approximately six lakh cases per annum to 36 lakh cases per annum — an additional 30 lakh cases. The current capacity is operating at close to 100 percent utilisation, and the expansion is expected to be completed within the next 12 months. Last month, the company announced the acquisition of Imperial Blue Brands from Pernod Ricard India for an enterprise value of Rs 4,150 crore, marking its foray into the country's whiskey segment. With the acquisition, the company will become one of the leading players in brandy and whiskey, the two largest Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) categories. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sensex, Nifty to open marginally higher; key levels to track on August 12
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex are set for a positive start on Tuesday, August 12, building on the momentum from Monday’s strong opening to the week. Around 8 am, GIFT Nifty was up 26 points, or 0.1 percent, at 24,597, signalling a steady opening for domestic equities. Bulls staged a strong comeback on August 11, with benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty climbing nearly a percent each, driven by robust buying in PSU banking, realty, and auto stocks. The rebound came as investors shook off last week’s tariff-induced volatility, which had pushed the Nifty to a three-month low and resulted in the index’s longest weekly losing streak in five years. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign Institutional Investors stood as net sellers of equity shares worth Rs 1,202 crore. On the other hand, the market was buoyed by continued positive interest from Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) as they were net buyers of equity shares worth Rs 5,972 crore. Here are the key levels to watch out for in today's session Nifty, after slipping to a low of 24,350 in the previous session, staged a strong rebound to close near the 24,600 mark, easing sentiment to some extent. A decisive move above 24,630 would be needed to strengthen the bias, while immediate support lies at 24,300. Sustaining this level could pave the way for further gains in the coming sessions. Bank Nifty also recovered, taking support at its 100-EMA level of 54,950. The index faces stiff resistance around 56,000, with crucial support at 54,900. For the day, Nifty is expected to trade in the 24,400–24,800 range, while Bank Nifty’s range is seen between 54,800 and 56,200. The fear gauge, India VIX, extended its upward journey for another session, climbing to an intraday high of 12.73 before closing at 12.22, up 1.54 percent. The index sustained above short-term moving averages, signalling caution for bulls. Also read: Trump extends tariff deadline for China by another 90 days The Nifty Put-Call ratio (PCR), which indicates the mood of the market, jumped to 1.03 on August 11, compared to 0.66 in the previous session. The increasing PCR, or being higher than 0.7 or surpassing 1, means traders are selling more Put options than Call options, which generally indicates the firming up of a bullish sentiment in the market. title: Bata India shares slip 3% as Q1 profit tumbles 70% YoY due to muted demand
content: Shares of Bata India declined 3 percent to Rs 1,152 on August 12 after the footwear maker posted a lacklustre performance for the June quarter (Q1FY26). So far in 2025, the stock has slipped 15 percent, sharply underperforming the benchmark Nifty 50’s 2 percent gain in the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, consolidated net profit plunged 70 percent year-on-year to Rs 52 crore, dragged down by higher expenses, muted consumer demand, and an unfavourable high base effect. In the same quarter last fiscal, the company had reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 174 crore. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 941.85 crore in Q1FY26, marginally lower than Rs 944.63 crore in the year-ago period. Total expenses rose to Rs 884 crore during the quarter, compared with Rs 878 crore in the corresponding period last year. “The quarter witnessed headwinds accentuated by fluctuating weather patterns and geopolitical uncertainties. Amidst these and considering the demand trends, we pushed ahead our affordability initiatives across categories to drive volume-based growth,” said Gunjan Shah, MD and CEO, Bata India. On the outlook, Shah added, “We are optimistic about the consumption recovery towards the balance of this year, backed by our strong market positioning and wide network, while maintaining a strong focus on cost efficiencies.” Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Inox Green shares gain 3% on signing agreement for 182 MW wind projects
content: Inox Green Energy share price gained 3 percent on August 12 after the company entered into an agreement with one of the largest and most diversified Indian conglomerates for the comprehensive O&M of 182 MW of operational wind projects housed under its renewable energy arm. At 09:44 hrs Inox Green Energy Services was quoting at Rs 161.25, up Rs 5.60, or 3.60 percent, on the BSE. The projects are located across multiple sites in Western India plugged into the common infrastructure owned by the company, Inox Green said in its release. The agreement involves the conversion of limited-scope to comprehensive O&M for 82 MW of wind projects, as well as the renewal of comprehensive O&M for another 100 MW of wind projects, much ahead of its due renewal. The contract spans the entire balance life of the wind projects, it added. "We are excited to announce the signing of the comprehensive O&M agreements for 182 MW with the renewable arm of one of the largest conglomerates in India. This is a milestone occasion for us as with the signing of the agreement, our entire fleet with this marquee customer is now back in our fold," said SK Mathu Sudhana, CEO of Inox Green. "This showcases the changing dynamics in the wind O&M industry and the reaffirmation of the trust which our customers are showing on our renewed capabilities,” he added.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a muted start today, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 24,567.50 earlier this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Benchmark indices started the week on a strong note after six weeks of negative close, erasing most of Friday's losses as bulls took the charge on August 11 with Nifty above 24,500 near the day's high on buying across sectors barring consumer durables. At close, the Sensex was up 746.29 points or 0.93 percent at 80,604.08, and the Nifty was up 221.75 points or 0.91 percent at 24,585.05. The BSE Midcap index added 0.8 percent and Smallcap index rose 0.35 percent at close. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Flat) The GIFT Nifty is trading flat at around 24,567.50, indicating a muted start for the day. Asian Equities (Gain) Asian stocks opened higher after a US-China tariff truce offered relief to markets ahead of a key USinflation report expected to shape the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path. US Equities (Down) Wall Street's main indexes ended lower on Monday as investors anxiously await inflation data this week to assess the outlook for interest rates and eye U.S.-China trade developments. The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed 200.52 points, or 0.45%, lower to 43,975.09, the S&P 500 lost 16.00 points, or 0.25%, to 6,373.45 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 64.62 points, or 0.3%, to 21,385.40. US Bond Yield (Flat) The yield on 10-year Treasuries and 2-year Treasuries were little changed in the opening trade on Tuesday. Dollar Index (Flat) The U.S. dollar held steady on Tuesday, with markets braced for a key consumer inflation report later in the day that could shape expectations for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. Asian currencies (Mixed) Asian currencies were trading mixed against the US dollar in the early trade on Tuesday. Crude (Up) Oil prices rose on Tuesday as the United States and China extended a pause on higher tariffs, easing concerns an escalation of their trade war would disrupt their economies and crimp fuel demand in the world's two largest oil consumers. Gold (Gains) Gold held a loss after President Donald Trump said imports of bullion won’t be subject to US tariffs,although traders were still waiting for formal clarification over the policy following a federal ruling last week that sowed chaos and confusion across the market. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities little more than Rs 1200 crore on August 11, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 5972 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. title: Bulk-Block deals: Warburg Pincus exits Home First Finance, HDFC MF offloads 1.4% shares in Repco Home Finance
content: Orange Clove Investments BV, an affiliate of global private equity investor Warburg Pincus, has exited Home First Finance Company India through open market transactions on August 11. Despite which, the stock clocked 6.65 percent rally today, closing at Rs 1,282.2 amid strong volumes on the NSE. Orange Clove Investments BV sold 1,09,80,033 equity shares (equivalent to 10.6 percent stake) in the housing finance company at Rs 1,190.5 per share, valued at Rs 1,307.2 crore, the block deals data published on the exchanges showed. Founded in 1966, Warburg Pincus, the firm which focussed on growth investing, had invested Rs 700 crore in home-grown private equity firm True North-backed Home First Finance in October 2020. On the flip side, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup, Bandhan Mutual Fund, VQ Fastercap Fund, Dendana Investments Mauritius, Fidelity, HDFC Life Insurance Company, HSBC MF, ITI MF, Kotak Mahindra MF, Motilal Oswal MF, Norges Bank, and Tata AIG General Insurance Company were among buyers for 1.09 crore shares in Home First Finance. Repco Home Finance was also in focus on Monday, declining just 0.09 percent despite HDFC Mutual Fund selling 1.4 percent stake in the housing finance company. HDFC MF offloaded 4.81 lakh shares in Repco at Rs 384.55 per share, and 4 lakh shares at Rs 386.5 per share, amounting to Rs 33.97 crore. The action was also seen in Network People Services Technologies (NPST), which showed healthy recovery of over 5 percent from early trade lows and closed with 1.86 percent loss at Rs 2081.6. Tata Mutual Fund bought 4.3 lakh shares (equivalent to 2.2 percent stake) at Rs 2,073.99 per share. This seems to be the first mutual fund house picking stake in Network People, the financial technology solutions provider, as till June 2025 shareholding pattern, there was no investor from the mutual fund section. However, promoters in total offloaded 5.3 lakh shares (equivalent to 2.75 percent stake) worth Rs 110.6 crore in NPST. Deepak Chand Thakur sold 1.63 lakh shares at Rs 2,074.25 per share, Savita Vashist offloaded 2.1 lakh shares at Rs 2,074.02 per share, and Ashish Aggarwal 1.6 lakh shares at Rs 2,074.03 per share. FlySBS Aviation shares were locked in 5 percent upper circuit, extending upward journey for second consecutive session. The stock made debut on the NSE Emerge on August 8, soaring 99.5 percent to close at Rs 448.85 per share. R G Family Trust, managed through trustees Harsh Vardhan Goenka and Anant Goenka, bought 1.06 lakh shares in FlySBS at Rs 471.25 per share. Promoters Venkata Rama Gaddam, and Satyanarayana Raju Bhupathiraju sold 2,06,164 shares in Vineet Laboratories at Rs 33.5 per share. However, Ajay Agrawal, Vasudev Agrawal, Rajendra Agrawal, and Jyoti Agarwal purchased 2 lakh shares at same price. The stock price finished at Rs 33.76, up 2 percent. Meanwhile, there was also some action in rights shares of Inox Wind. The stock rallied 12 percent to Rs 21.57. BofA Securities Europe SA bought 13.35 lakh rights shares at Rs 19 per share, however, Smallcap World Fund Inc sold 16.05 lakh shares at Rs 19.16 per share.

title: Hindalco subsidiary Novelis working to mitigate tariff headwinds, expects resilient demand for aluminium
content: Novelis told analysts during an investor call on August 11 after June quarter earnings that despite tariff-related pressures, the aluminium smelting company is eyeing long-term growth through its Alabama greenfield rolling and recycling plant that will have a 600kt capacity upon completion. The company is aiming to defend volumes through tariff mitigation strategies, after it shared that the Q1FY26 adjusted EBITDA includes a net negative tariff impact of $28 million. The Hindalco subsidiary has projected the FY26 capex to be in the range of $1.9-2.2 billion. Novelis CFO Dev Ahuja said the company is 'finding opportunities' to streamline costs, in response to the 'challenging external environment'. US President Trump’s 50 percent tariff on steel and aluminium is expected to impact prices of electronics, cars and several other products. The management said it is confident of 'resilient' demand for aluminium packaging, and sees strong growth to continue in packaging. "We continue to see strong demand for aluminum beverage packaging sheet supporting top-line growth and the need for new capacity under construction at our plant in Bay Minette, Alabama," Steve Fisher, President and CEO of Novelis Inc said. High prices for aluminium scrap hurt the financial performance for the June quarter, but the company is making 'solid progress' on cost reduction which is expected to lower cost base and improve margins, the CEO added. Novelis added that it is looking to accelerate cost reduction steps, which can drive higher cost savings in FY26, and over $300 million by end of FY28. Due to tariff-related uncertainty, Novelis had withheld volume and margin guidance for FY26.
summary_lexrank: The company is aiming to defend volumes through tariff mitigation strategies, after it shared that the Q1FY26 adjusted EBITDA includes a net negative tariff impact of $28 million.
