title: Taking Stock: Bulls powers Nifty above 24,550, Sensex up 0.9 percent in broad-based rebound
content: Benchmark indices started the week on a strong note after six weeks of negative close, erasing most of Friday's losses as bulls took the charge on August 11 with Nifty above 24,500 near the day's high on buying across sectors barring consumer durables. At close, the Sensex was up 746.29 points or 0.93 percent at 80,604.08, and the Nifty was up 221.75 points or 0.91 percent at 24,585.05. The BSE Midcap index added 0.8 percent and Smallcap index rose 0.35 percent at close. Also Read: S Naren’s new investment mantra: Take the 10% and run Biggest Nifty gainers were Adani Enterprises, Tata Motors, Eternal, Grasim Industries, Apollo Hospitals, while losers included Hero MotoCorp, Bharat Electronics, Bharti Airtel. Except consumer durables, all other sectoral indices ended in the green with pharma, metal, auto, oil & gas, PSU Bank and realty up 0.5-2 percent. Also Read: Centre plans divestments in LIC, public sector banks beyond SEBI's requirements: Report In stock-specific action, Ceigall India shares fell 4 percent on weak earnings, Grasim Industries shares rose 2% on positive results, Home First Finance share price added 6 percent after large block deal, DOMS Industries shares surged 12 percent on profit and revenue jump, Voltas shares shed 5% as results missed estimates, PG Electroplast shares fell 14 percent on weak earnings, Sun TV shares rose after notices to promoter by family member were withdrawn, and Manappuram Finance shares fell 1% on dismal results. Nearly 120 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including Sai Life Sciences, Paytm, Indian Bank, Fortis Healthcare, Nuvoco Vistas, Delhivery, eClerx Services, among others. Click to View More Outlook for August 12 Shrikant Chouhan, Head Equity Research, Kotak Securities Today, the benchmark indices bounced back sharply, with the Nifty ends 222 points higher, while the Sensex was up by 746 points. Among sectors, almost all the major sectoral indices traded in positive territory, but the PSU Bank index outperformed, rallying over 2 percent. Technically, after a long correction, the market has formed a reversal pattern on daily charts. Additionally, a bullish candle on daily charts also supports further uptrend from the current levels. We believe that 24,500/80400 and 24,445/80200 would act as key support zones for day traders. Above these levels, the pullback move is likely to continue till 24,700-24,750/81000-81200. On the flip side, below 24,445/80200, sentiment could turn negative. Traders may then prefer to exit their long positions. Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities The Nifty picked up right where it left off on Friday, but with an entirely different mood. Rising from the ashes, the index staged a spirited comeback, adding nearly 200 points through the day. The earlier breakdown now seems to have given way to a short-term pullback, as the market brushed aside recent weakness. We’re not completely out of the woods yet, but Monday’s bounce from the recent low carries enough steam to power further gains. Immediate support lies at 24,337, with the next upside targets seen around 24,850 and 25,000. title: Data Patterns, Mazagon Dock, other defence shares rise up to 4.5% after three-session fall: Here are 5 key reasons
content: The shares of defence companies recorded strong gains on August 11. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Defence index up nearly 1.3 percent, snapping a three-session losing streak. Paras Defence and Astra Microwave Products shares were the top gainer on the index by jumping 4.5 percent each to trade at Rs 651 and Rs 999 apiece, while Data Patterns shares gained around 4 percent. Solar Industries and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders were up nearly 3 percent, while GRSE and Zen Tech gained nearly 2 percent. Heavyweights Bharat Dynamics (BDL) and Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) were up around 1 percent each. Here are the likely triggers for the sharp rise in the share prices: India's annual defence production hits all time high in FY25: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took to X platform on August 9 (Saturday) to announce that India’s annual defence production soared to an all-time high of Rs 1.51 lakh crore in FY25. This marks a strong growth of 18 percent from the Rs 1.27 lakh crore annual output reported for FY24. The defence production rose a whopping 90 percent on-year from the Rs 79,071 crore output reported for FY20. "I commend the collective efforts of the Department of DefenceProduction and all stakeholders i.e., DPSUs, public sector manufacturers, and the private industry in achieving this landmark. This upward trajectory is a clear indicator of India's strengthening defence industrial base," the defence minister wrote in a post on X.Under the leadership of Prime Minister Shri @narendramodi India’s defence production has hit a record high! The annual defence production has soared to an all-time high figure of Rs 1,50,590 crore in the Financial Year (FY) 2024-25. These numbers indicate a robust 18% growth… — Rajnath Singh (@rajnathsingh) August 9, 2025 DRDO chief praises Indian defence equipment’s success during Operation Sindoor: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) Chairman Samir Kamat on August 9 (Saturday) said BrahMos missiles and the Akashteer defence systems played key roles in 'Operation Sindoor'. "Operation Sindoor was more than a mission. It was a declaration of India’s ability to stand tall through self-reliance, strategic foresight, and indigenous technological strength. It was a statement to the world that India has the capability to protect its borders through homegrown technology," he said while speaking at 14th convocation ceremony of Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT) in Pune. Kamat explained how BrahMos missile was used as the primary offensive weapon, while anti-drone Akashteer was used for defence. Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL) manufactures the BrahMos missile. Pakistan's threat to ‘blow up’ Indian dam: Pakistan’s Army Chief Asim Munir has vowed to destroy any dam or water infrastructure India might build on the Indus water channels, following New Delhi’s decision to place the Indus Waters Treaty into abeyance after the April Pahalgam terror attack. Speaking at an event in US, Munir said, "We will wait for India to build a dam, and when it does so, phir das missile sey faarigh kar dengey (we will destroy it with 10 missiles) … The Indus River is not the Indians’ family property. Humein missilon ki kami nahin hai (we have no shortage of missiles)," Munir reportedly said, while claiming that India’s move could put 250 million Pakistanis at risk of starvation. The latest threat from the Pakistani army chief has reignited possibility of escalations in geopolitical tensions, which may in turn boost the defence stocks. Defence shares earlier came in focus after the Indian military in May conducted targeted strikes against terrorist outfits in Pakistan and Pakistan occupied Kashmir under the codename 'Operation Sindoor'. As the geopolitical tensions between India and Pakistan eased, the escalating wars between Russia-Ukraine and Israel- Iran further boosted the stocks. However, investors resorted to profit booking recently as geopolitical tensions eased around the globe. Earnings: The sharp rise in share prices also comes as strong earnings by some of the notable players boosted investor sentiment. BEML on August 11 reported a net loss of Rs 64 crore for the April-June quarter of FY26. This marks a notable decline from the Rs 70.5 crore net loss reported for the corresponding quarter of FY25. Revenue from operations were unchanged at Rs 634 crore. GRSE on August 8 reported a net profit of Rs 120 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a 38 percent on-year rise from the Rs 87 crore net profit reported in Q1 FY25. However, net profit nearly halved sequentially from the Rs 244 crore reported in Q4 FY25. BEML is set to announce its results for the April-June quarter of FY25 today. Value buying: Defence stocks have seen significant correction recently. After rallying a whopping 42 percent since beginning of the year to hit a record high in June, the Nifty India Defence index dropped more than 17 percent as analysts flagged stretched valuations. However, investors may have taken a relook at the stocks after the significant correction, pushing the stocks higher on value buying. title: Buy Signature Global; target of Rs 1760: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Signature Global Signature Global achieved pre-sales of INR26.4b in 1QFY26, down 15% YoY but up 63% QoQ (12% below our estimate), aided by the launch of ‘Cloverdale SPR’, a premium residential project located on Southern Peripheral Road (SPR), Sector 71, Gurugram. Area sold in the quarter stood at 1.6msf, down 20% YoY and up 19% QoQ (12% below our estimates). Average sales realization stood at INR16,296/sqft, up 6% YoY/37% QoQ. Higher realization was attributed to the launch of Cloverdale SPR. Outlook We reiterate our BUY rating with a TP of INR1,760 indicating a 58% upside potential. title: Buy Metro Brands; target of Rs 1325: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Metro Brands Metro Brands’ (MBL) 1QFY26 revenue grew 9% YoY on a low base (-1% YoY in 1QFY25), driven by a 45% growth in E-commerce and a modest ~4% YoY growth in in-store sales (on the back of ~8% YoY area additions). EBITDA grew 8% YoY (6% miss), as margin contracted ~45bp to 30.9% due to higher marketing spends and ~15bp dip in gross margin. 1QFY26 was impacted by a shift in Eid dates, early monsoon, and subdued consumer sentiments. However, management reiterated its long-term target of 15-18% revenue CAGR, driven by mid-to-high single digit SSSG, store additions, and rising contribution from newer formats. Further, with its robust cost controls and strong store economics, management continues to target over 30% EBITDA and mid-teen PAT margins. Outlook We reiterate our BUY rating on MBL with a revised TP of INR1,325, premised on 65x Sept’27 EPS. Consistent double-digit growth and the ramp-up of newer formats such as FILA, Foot Locker, and Clarks remain key re-rating triggers for the stock. title: Buy Kalpataru Projects; target of Rs 1450: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Kalpataru Projects Kalpataru Projects (KPIL) reported a sharp beat on revenue and PAT during 1QFY26. This was driven by strong execution across T&D, B&F, and the oil & gas division. The company continues to benefit from a strong prospect pipeline in T&D and buildings & factories. We anticipate KPIL to benefit from 1) incremental T&D awarding on both domestic and international fronts, 2) execution ramp-up of the existing strong order book, and 3) comfortable working capital. We marginally raise our estimates by 3%/1% for FY26/27 to bake in the 1QFY26 performance. The stock is currently trading at attractive valuations of 20.7x/15.8x P/E on FY26/27 earnings. Reiterate BUY with an unchanged SoTP-based TP of INR1,450, valued at 18x P/E for the core business. Outlook KPIL is currently trading at 20.7x/15.8x P/E on FY26/27 earnings. title: Buy Indigo Paints; target of Rs 1400: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Indigo Paints Indigo Paints’ (INDIGOPN) standalone sales were flat YoY in 1QFY26 due to consistent demand headwinds and the early onset of monsoon. Apple Chemie’s (subsidiary) sales declined 18% YoY. Consolidated sales declined 1% YoY to INR3.1b (below). Management indicated that while the first half of the quarter saw a healthy offtake, the early onset of monsoon, especially in East and South, dented 1Q’s performance. However, July saw an improvement in demand, and management expects this growth momentum to sustain, anticipating a healthy pent-up demand in 2HFY26. The company indicated that it does not anticipate any significant competitive intensity in the near term. We model a CAGR of 14%/16% in revenue/EBITDA in FY26-28E. Outlook We reiterate our BUY rating with a revised TP of INR1,400 (premised on 35x Jun’27E EPS). title: Buy HPCL; target of Rs 520: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on HPCL HPCL’s 1QFY26 EBITDA was 9% below our est., led by lower-than-estimated GRM (USD3.1/bbl). GRM, adj. for inventory gains, stood at USD6.5/bbl. Marketing margin stood 10% above estimates at INR7/lit. Resultant PAT was 11% below our est. at INR43.7b. The Union Cabinet has approved INR300b in LPG compensation to OMCs, which will be paid in 12 tranches. While the disbursement timeline remains undisclosed, we estimate HPCL to receive ~INR40.5b in both FY26/27 (~27% of total compensation). This will result in ~9% increase in HPCL’s FY27E BVPS. Outlook HPCL currently trades at 1.2x FY27E P/B, which we believe offers a reasonable margin of safety as we estimate FY27E RoE of 15%. We value the stock at our SoTP-based TP of INR520/sh. Reiterate BUY. title: Buy Global Health; target of Rs 1630: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Global Health Global Health (Medanta) delivered better-than-expected 1QFY26. Improved performance in mature as well as developing hospitals led to a 7%/6%/11% beat on our sales/EBITDA/PAT estimates for the quarter. Medanta achieved its highest-ever quarterly revenue, supported by increased patient volumes and improved realization. Notably, 1QFY26 is the first quarter to witness an increase in ARPOB in Patna, led by improved efficiency. This resulted in a dip in Average Length of Stay (ALOS). However, the performance was partly offset by an increase in the share of institutional patients at Lucknow, affecting ARPOB for developing hospitals. Outlook We broadly retain our estimates for FY26/FY27. We value Medanta at 30x 12M forward EV/EBITDA to arrive at our TP of INR1,630. title: Buy Equitas Small Finance Bank; target of Rs 70: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Equitas Small Finance Bank Equitas SFB (EQUITASB) reported a net loss of INR2.24b vs our estimate of PAT of INR220m, driven by a sharp rise in provisions due to stress in MFI and changes in the provisioning policy. NII declined 2% YoY/5% QoQ to INR7.8b (in-line), amid declining yields due to shrinking MFI book and increased stress. NIM contracted 58bp QoQ to 6.55% (our est of 6.88%). Advances declined 4% QoQ (up 8.8% YoY) amid a sharp decline in the MFI portfolio (down 21.9% QoQ), which now stands at 9.4% of the portfolio. Meanwhile, deposits grew 18.3% YoY/3.0% QoQ, led by a sharp increase in CA deposits (up 92% YoY/36.7% QoQ). As a result, CASA ratio increased to 29.4%. Outlook We cut our earnings sharply by 86%/21% for FY26/27E and estimate FY27E RoA/ RoE at 1.1%/ 11.5%. Reiterate BUY with a TP of INR70 (1.3x FY27E ABV). title: Buy Cummins India; target of Rs 4350: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Cummins India Cummins India (KKC) reported a strong set of results with a beat on all parameters. Revenue growth was fueled by sharp growth in powergen and exports, followed by distribution. KKC seems to have gained market share during the quarter, with a sharp growth seen in the powergen segment revenues as compared to the nearest peer. We expect KKC to benefit from 1) demand improvement in the powergen segment as prices have largely stabilized, 2) customized product offerings in the industrial segment and improved penetration for the distribution segment, and 3) recovery in exports. We broadly maintain our estimates and roll forward our valuations to 41x Sep’27E earnings. We reiterate our BUY rating with a revised TP of INR4,350. Outlook The stock is currently trading at 45.6x/38.7x/33.3x on FY26/27/28E EPS. We reiterate our BUY rating on the stock with a revised TP of INR4,350 (based on 41x Sep’27E earnings). title: Buy Biocon; target of Rs 410: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Biocon Biocon (BIOS) reported lower-than-expected financial performance in 1QFY26, affected mainly by a sharp reduction in generics sales and increased opex related to new facilities. While it was a dismal quarter for the generics segment, BIOS has a pipeline of product approval/launches lined up for the near to medium term to improve growth prospects and profitability. Biologics sales witnessed improved traction from commercialized molecules in both advanced as well as emerging markets. Outlook We value BIOS on an SOTP basis (20x 12M forward EV/EBITDA for 73% stake in Biocon Biologics, 53% stake in Syngene, and 10x EV/EBITDA for the Generics business) to arrive at a TP of INR410. title: Buy Apollo Tyres; target of Rs 520: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Apollo Tyres Apollo Tyres (APTY)’s 1QFY26 consolidated performance was in line with our estimates. However, while standalone performance was much ahead of our estimates, the European business margin was weaker than expected. On account of its weak performance in Europe, we reduce our EPS estimates by 10%/6% over FY26/FY27E. We factor in a 60bp improvement in APTY’s margin during our forecast period, driving a 21% PAT CAGR over a corrected base. Valuations at 15.2x FY27E appear attractive, especially when compared to peers. We reiterate our BUY rating on APTY with a TP of INR520 (valued at 18x Jun’27E consol. EPS). title: Buy Cera Sanitaryware; target of Rs 8956: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Cera Sanitaryware Amidst the subdued demand environment, Cera Sanitaryware reported a stable performance. Revenue grew 5.4% y/y to Rs4.2bn, largely supported by faucets as sanitaryware revenue was flat. The productmix change led to a 2% y/y rise in gross profit to Rs2.2bn, while higher employee expenses dragged EBITDA down 5.1% y/y to Rs551m. PAT slipped 1.1% y/y to Rs466m. We introduce FY28e and expect 12%/14% revenue/earnings CAGRs over FY25-28. Considering the 11% fall in the stock price in the past one month, we believe the risk-reward to be favourable. Outlook Also, significant cash on the books provide assurance; hence, we upgrade our rating on the stock to a Buy with a 12-mth TP of Rs8,956, 35x the average of FY27e/FY28e EPS (earlier Rs8,034, 35x FY27 earnings). title: Buy State Bank of India; target of Rs 908: LKP Research
content: LKP Research's research report on State Bank of India State Bank of India (SBI) delivered a decent quarterly performance supported by healthy broad-based loan growth and improved profitability. This was on the back of strong operating efficiency amid high provision expense in a seasonally weak quarter. The bank’s NIM moderated on higher cost of deposits and is expected to remain range bound in the near term as deposit rates are expected to remain sticky despite recent repo rate cut. However, the impact of rate cut on margins is expected to be minimal due to its lower share of repo linked loans. Further, the bank’s asset quality continues to remain strong, in a challenging macro environment with effective collection efficiency and robust underwriting. With a continued focus on digital transformation, strategic provisioning buffers, and healthy capital levels, SBI is well-positioned to capitalize on improving macro conditions. Outlook Hence, we reiterate our BUY rating on the stock with a Sum-of-the-Parts (SOTP)-based target price of ₹908. This includes valuing the core bank at 1.3x FY27E BVPS, and attributing ₹119/share to its subsidiaries. title: Buy Emami; target of Rs 690: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Emami Emami’s Q1FY26 performance was hit by unseasonal and early rains that led to a 17% decline in summer products, while pain management grew 17% y-o-y, aided by monsoon-led demand. Core domestic business (ex-talc/heat powder) grew 6% y-o-y, led by 3% volume growth. Consolidated revenue stood flat y-o-y, while higher other income and a lower tax rate led to 8% y-o-y growth in the adjusted PAT. OPM at 23.7%, slightly fell by 20 bps y-o-y. Emami continues to leverage innovation, distribution expansion, digital acceleration, and cost optimization to drive profitable growth going ahead. This coupled with a gradual demand recovery will further support growth in the coming months. Outlook Stock trades at 27x/25x its FY26E/FY27E EPS, respectively. We maintain a Buy with a revised PT of Rs. 690. content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Kalpataru Projects International Standalone revenues grew strongly by 35% led by a surge in T&D (56%), oil & gas (132%), urban infrastructure (42%) and B&F (13%) businesses, but this was offset by a decline in the water segment (5%). title: NSDL shares close in red for the first time after 62% rally since listing; what lies ahead?
content: The shares of National Securities Depository (NSDL) saw some profit booking on August 11, dropping nearly 11 percent from its day’s high to close in the red for the first time ever. This comes after a record rally of nearly 62 percent since listing. The shares of the company dropped 2 percent to close at Rs 1,273 apiece. Earlier in the day, the stock had jumped nearly 10 percent to trade at Rs 1,425 apiece. The newly listed stock has now declined nearly 8.5 percent from that level. The shares of NSDL had made a decent stock market debut on August 6, listing at Rs 880 apiece on BSE. This marked a premium of 10 percent over its IPO price at Rs 880 apiece. The listing premium was lower than grey market estimates. Analysts had recommended investors to consider holding the stock for the long term, given NSDL’s strong fundamentals and leadership in the depository segment. NSDL’s P/E ratio currently stands at around 79, higher than that of peer CDSL whose P/E ratio currently stands at around 66. What lies ahead? "As one of only two depositories operating in a near-duopoly alongside CDSL, NSDL enjoys strong pricing power, high entry barriers, and a dominant share in value-based transactions and institutional account holdings," said Bhavik Joshi, Business Head, INVasset PMS. He noted that the stock's current P/E multiple of around 77 may appear stretched when compared to CDSL’s 66, but investors are clearly willing to pay a premium for its scale, technology backbone, and long-standing trust within the ecosystem. "That said, prospective investors should be mindful of certain structural risks — dependence on transaction volumes, evolving investor participation patterns, and the ever-present cybersecurity and regulatory compliance requirements. In the near term, valuations may moderate if market activity slows, offering potential entry points for those who missed the IPO," he added. Nitin Jain, Senior Research Analyst at Bonanza, said it is recommended for short-term and listing-gain-focused investors to book some profits. "The near-term upside may be capped after such a sharp move, and markets tend to see consolidation post a robust debut. If you are a long-term investor willing to ride out near-term volatility, NSDL remains a high-quality stock supported by rising demat penetration," he added. NSDL shares are now more expensive than its peer CDSL after its sharp rally, market expert Ambareesh Baliga told CNBC-TV18. "I think along with long investors shifting from CDSL to NSDL post listing, we have seen huge number of momentum trader getting in, which has pushed the stock higher. So, it will be ideal for IPO investors to book profits at current levels and make a shift back to CDSL," he said. Long term investors should use the dips to accumulate further, while short term investors should book profits after the record rally, Sunny Agarwal of SBI Securities told CNBC-TV18. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The shares of NSDL had made a decent stock market debut on August 6, listing at Rs 880 apiece on BSE.
summary_luhn: The shares of National Securities Depository (NSDL) saw some profit booking on August 11, dropping nearly 11 percent from its day’s high to close in the red for the first time ever.
summary_lsa: "I think along with long investors shifting from CDSL to NSDL post listing, we have seen huge number of momentum trader getting in, which has pushed the stock higher.
summary_textrank: He noted that the stock's current P/E multiple of around 77 may appear stretched when compared to CDSL’s 66, but investors are clearly willing to pay a premium for its scale, technology backbone, and long-standing trust within the ecosystem.

title: Voltas shares slump 8% after Q1 results miss Street estimates, brokerages remain cautious
content: Shares of Voltas fell 8 percent to Rs 1,202 per share on August 11 after its June-quarter (Q1FY26) results missed Street expectations. So far in 2025, the stock has fallen 33 percent, underperforming the Nifty 50 index’s 2 percent gain. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog CLSA maintained a “hold” rating but cut its target price to Rs 1,170 per share, citing a 20 percent year-on-year drop in revenue and a 400 basis point fall in EBITDA margin. The Unitary Cooling Products (UCP) segment’s revenue fell 25 percent year-on-year, with margins plunging to a 10-year low of 3.6 percent. Market share dropped to 17.8 percent from 19.5 percent. CLSA expects recovery from Q3 onwards but sees flat to a 10 percent decline in full-year industry growth, with high inventories continuing to weigh on utilisation and margins. Nomura retained its “neutral” rating with a target price of Rs 1,317 per share. It said Q1FY26 UCP margins missed sharply and warned that competitive intensity may keep margins under pressure despite recovery hopes. The brokerage cut its FY26 revenue growth forecast for room air conditioners to 5 percent, while keeping FY27 and FY28 estimates at 20 percent and 15 percent respectively. It also lowered UCP revenue growth forecasts to 6 percent for FY26 and 24 percent for FY27. In Q1FY26, Voltas’ net profit slumped 58 percent year-on-year to Rs 140.6 crore from Rs 334 crore in the same quarter last year, as unseasonal weather and muted summer demand hit cooling product sales. Revenue fell 20 percent to Rs 3,938.6 crore, while EBITDA halved to Rs 178.6 crore. Operating margins contracted to 4.5 percent from 8.6 percent a year earlier. Management attributed the weak performance to a delayed summer and early monsoon, which dented air-conditioner sales. A high base from last year—when prolonged heat waves boosted record demand—further amplified the decline. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Bharti Airtel shares trade higher, up 0.32% in morning session
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,864.50 in Monday's morning session, a 0.32% increase from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,866.00 and a low of Rs 1,849.20 in today's trade at 10:30 am. In terms of quarterly performance, the consolidated revenue for Bharti Airtel has shown consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 47,876.20 Crore in March 2025, Rs 45,129.30 Crore in December 2024, Rs 41,473.30 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,418.10 Crore in March 2025, Rs 14,474.90 Crore in December 2024, Rs 3,079.50 Crore in September 2024 and Rs 3,805.80 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 10.26, compared to Rs 19.02 in March 2025, Rs 25.54 in December 2024, Rs 6.21 in September 2024, and Rs 7.21 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for Bharti Airtel has also demonstrated growth over the past five years. In March 2025, the revenue was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, compared to Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024, Rs 139,144.80 Crore in March 2023, Rs 116,546.90 Crore in March 2022, and Rs 100,615.80 Crore in March 2021. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 33,778.30 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024, Rs 11,535.30 Crore in March 2023, Rs 5,882.00 Crore in March 2022, and a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in March 2021. The EPS for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 58.00, compared to Rs 13.09 in March 2024, Rs 14.80 in March 2023, Rs 7.67 in March 2022, and Rs -27.65 in March 2021. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025. Additionally, the company’s 30th Annual General Meeting's outcome and Consolidated Scrutinizer Report were announced on August 8, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 5, 2025, suggests a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,864.50, Bharti Airtel has shown a positive movement in today's session, reflecting a steady performance.

title: Tata Consultancy Services share price gains 0.12% in late morning trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares saw a marginal increase in Monday's trading session. At 10:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,040, a 0.12% increase from its previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,040.70 and a low of Rs 3,021.30 during the session. Financial Performance Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past five years. Here's a summary:YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs.)BVPS (Rs.)ROE (%)Debt to Equity2021164,177.0032,562.0086.71235.4337.520.002022191,754.0038,449.00103.62245.4842.990.002023225,458.0042,303.00115.19249.2046.610.002024240,893.0046,099.00125.88252.2650.730.002025255,324.0048,797.00134.19261.7651.240.00The company's revenue increased by 6.0% from Rs 240,893.00 Crore in 2024 to Rs 255,324.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a rise of 5.85%, increasing from Rs 46,099.00 Crore to Rs 48,797.00 Crore during the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 125.88 in 2024 to Rs 134.19 in 2025. Here's a summary of the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 202462,613.0012,105.0033.28Sep 202464,259.0011,955.0032.92Dec 202463,973.0012,444.0034.21Mar 202564,479.0012,293.0033.79Jun 202563,437.0012,819.0035.27The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437.00 Crore, compared to Rs 62,613.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period increased to Rs 12,819.00 Crore from Rs 12,105.00 Crore. The EPS also increased from 33.28 to 35.27 year-over-year. The following table shows the sales, other income, total income, total expenditure, EBIT, interest, tax, and net profit for the year ending March 2025, March 2024, March 2023, March 2022, and March 2021. All values are in Crore.ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales255,324240,893225,458191,754164,177Other Income3,9624,4223,4494,0183,134Total Income259,286245,315228,907195,772167,311Total Expenditure193,159182,540171,221143,301122,914EBIT66,12762,77557,68652,47144,397Interest796778779784637Tax16,53415,89814,60413,23811,198Net Profit48,79746,09942,30338,44932,562The following table shows the sales, other income, total income, total expenditure, EBIT, interest, tax and net profit for the quarter ending June 2025, March 2025, December 2024, September 2024 and June 2024. All values are in Crore.ParticularsJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales63,43764,47963,97364,25962,613Other Income1,6601,0281,243729962Total Income65,09765,50765,21664,98863,575Total Expenditure47,92348,87848,31648,79447,171EBIT17,17416,62916,90016,19416,404Interest195227234162173Tax4,1604,1094,2224,0774,126Net Profit12,81912,29312,44411,95512,105The consolidated cash flow from operating activities was Rs 48,908 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 44,338 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The balance sheet for the year ending March 2025 shows that the total assets were Rs 159,629 Crore, with fixed assets at Rs 22,739 Crore and current assets at Rs 123,012 Crore. Key Ratios Key financial ratios for Tata Consultancy Services show a P/E ratio of 26.87 and a P/B ratio of 13.77. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services has announced several dividends. Most recently, an interim dividend of Rs 11 per share was announced on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. The company also issued a final dividend of Rs 30 per share on April 11, 2025, which became effective on June 4, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the last bonus issue on April 19, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. The ex-bonus date was May 31, 2018. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,040, Tata Consultancy Services shows a slight gain in today's session, reflecting ongoing financial growth and active corporate actions.

title: Dixon Technologies shares rise 2.02% in today's trading session
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 16,185.00 on Monday's session, driven by positive investor sentiment. The stock is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Dixon Technologies' financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. Here's an overview of the company's financial highlights:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,448.17159.7927.49125.8921.670.21202210,697.08190.3932.31168.0419.070.46202312,192.01253.4642.92215.7219.880.14202417,690.90364.6862.84288.0421.690.09202538,860.101,215.20205.70499.6236.390.07The company's revenue increased significantly from Rs 17,690.90 Crore in 2024 to Rs 38,860.10 Crore in 2025. Similarly, net profit rose sharply from Rs 364.68 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,215.20 Crore in 2025.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 20246,579.80132.2623.35Sep 202411,534.08409.1068.82Dec 202410,453.68212.6536.12Mar 202510,292.54461.1977.59Jun 202512,835.66273.2646.47The quarterly revenue saw a substantial increase from Rs 6,579.80 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 12,835.66 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also increased, though with fluctuations, from Rs 132.26 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 273.26 Crore in June 2025. Here is the yearly income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales38,86017,69012,19210,6976,448Other Income2022531Total Income38,88017,71312,19710,7006,449Total Expenditure37,17317,15511,79310,4016,205EBIT1,706558403298244Interest15474604427Tax337118896457Net Profit1,215364253190159The company's sales have shown significant growth over the years, with sales for March 2025 reaching 38,860 compared to 6,448 in March 2021. Net profit has also seen a substantial increase, from 159 in March 2021 to 1,215 in March 2025. Here is the quarterly income statement:Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales12,83510,29210,45311,5346,579Other Income1116-58Total Income12,83710,30310,46011,5286,587Total Expenditure12,4459,68510,13710,9646,386EBIT391618322564201Interest3246403729Tax851116811740Net Profit273461212409132The company's sales have generally increased over the quarters, with sales for June 2025 reaching 12,835 compared to 6,579 in June 2024. Net profit has also seen an increase, from 132 in June 2024 to 273 in June 2025. Dixon Technologies has announced several corporate actions, including analyst/investor meets. The company's officials met with analysts/advisors/investors of Neuberger Berman, as announced on August 8, 2025. Prior to that, there was also scheduled Meeting between the officials of the Company and the Analyst(s)/advisor(s)/investor(s) of Marcellus Investment Managers. The company has a history of dividend payouts. The most recent final dividend was announced on May 15, 2024, at Rs 5.00 per share (250%), with an effective date of September 18, 2024. The company also had a stock split on March 18, 2021, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2. With the stock currently trading at Rs 16,185.00, Dixon Technologies demonstrates positive movement in today's session, driven by investor activity and supported by robust financial performance.

content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam gained 2.26% to trade at Rs 344.20 in Monday's session, with the stock emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:28 am, the stock showed positive movement compared to its previous close. title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares rise 2.70%
content: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders' stock price experienced a rise of 2.70%, reaching Rs 2,708.00 in Monday's session. At 10:25 am, the stock demonstrated positive movement compared to its previous close, reflecting ongoing market activity. This increase positions the stock among notable performers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Performance: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,431.88 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 9,466.58 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Similarly, the net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,277.34 Crore, up from Rs 1,808.88 Crore in the previous year.The earning per share stood at Rs 59.83 in year ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROEDebt to Equity20214,047.82453.4725.48170.1514.970.0020225,733.28563.1130.29191.2715.830.0020237,827.181,046.0755.48236.0223.500.0020249,466.581,808.8896.04309.5631.020.00202511,431.882,277.3459.83196.8330.390.00The company has demonstrated strong growth, with revenue increasing by 15.82% from Rs 9,466.58 Crore in 2024 to Rs 11,431.88 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial increase of 25.95% from Rs 1,808.88 Crore to Rs 2,277.34 Crore over the same period. Quarterly Financials: The consolidated quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 2,625.59 Crore, compared to Rs 3,174.41 Crore for March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 419.28 Crore, lower than the Rs 290.42 Crore reported in the previous quarter.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 20242,357.02665.9434.51Sep 20242,756.83552.7629.01Dec 20243,143.62768.2220.01Mar 20253,174.41290.428.06Jun 20252,625.59419.2811.21Corporate Actions: The company announced the publication of unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, on July 30, 2025. The board approved these results on July 28, 2025. Additionally, the company approved the acquisition of a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC on June 27, 2025. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders announced an interim dividend of Rs 3.00 per share (60%) with an effective date of April 16, 2025. The company also executed a stock split, reducing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5, with an ex-split date of December 27, 2024. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,708.00, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shows a positive trend in today's session, driven by financial performance and strategic corporate actions.

title: SJVN shares rise 2.04% in morning trade on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of SJVN gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 93.98 in Monday's session. At 10:23 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting an increase from its previous close and is trading among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. The company's board is scheduled to meet on August 11, 2025, to consider and approve the financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Financial Performance: SJVN's financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated quarterly data:Revenue: The company's revenue has shown fluctuation over the last five quarters. It increased from Rs 482.91 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 870.37 Crore in June 2024, further to Rs 1,026.25 Crore in September 2024, before declining to Rs 670.99 Crore in December 2024 and then slightly recovering to Rs 504.40 Crore in March 2025.Net Profit: The net profit saw a significant rise from Rs 60.16 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 356.19 Crore in June 2024 and Rs 438.88 Crore in September 2024. However, it decreased to Rs 147.61 Crore in December 2024, and further declined to a loss of Rs 130.36 Crore in March 2025.EPS: The earnings per share followed a similar trend, increasing from Rs 0.16 in March 2024 to Rs 0.91 in June 2024 and Rs 1.12 in September 2024, then falling to Rs 0.38 in December 2024, and finally recording a negative value of Rs -0.32 in March 2025.HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 482.91 CroreRs 870.37 CroreRs 1,026.25 CroreRs 670.99 CroreRs 504.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 60.16 CroreRs 356.19 CroreRs 438.88 CroreRs 147.61 Crore-Rs 130.36 CroreEPS0.160.911.120.38-0.32The yearly financial data provides the following insights:Revenue: The company's revenue has generally increased over the years, with some fluctuations. It rose from Rs 2,485.39 Crore in 2021 to Rs 2,417.00 Crore in 2022, then to Rs 2,938.35 Crore in 2023, before slightly decreasing to Rs 2,579.37 Crore in 2024 and then increasing to Rs 3,072.01 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: The net profit has seen a decreasing trend overall. It decreased from Rs 1,641.78 Crore in 2021 to Rs 985.31 Crore in 2022, then increased to Rs 1,355.05 Crore in 2023, before falling to Rs 907.25 Crore in 2024 and further to Rs 812.32 Crore in 2025.EPS: The earnings per share followed a similar pattern, decreasing from Rs 4.19 in 2021 to Rs 2.63 in 2022, then increasing to Rs 3.46 in 2023, before falling to Rs 2.32 in 2024 and further to Rs 2.08 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,485.39 CroreRs 2,417.00 CroreRs 2,938.35 CroreRs 2,579.37 CroreRs 3,072.01 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,641.78 CroreRs 985.31 CroreRs 1,355.05 CroreRs 907.25 CroreRs 812.32 CroreEPS4.192.633.462.322.08BVPS32.5533.5135.2735.8136.08ROE12.867.519.806.475.78Debt to Equity0.150.521.011.441.90Dividend History: SJVN has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. Recent dividend announcements include:February 13, 2025: Interim dividend of Rs 1.15 per share (11.5%), effective February 21, 2025.May 29, 2024: Final dividend of Rs 0.65 per share (6.5%), effective September 12, 2024.February 9, 2024: Interim dividend of Rs 1.15 per share (11.5%), effective February 21, 2024.With the stock currently trading at Rs 93.98, SJVN has experienced a notable rise in today's session.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.60% in today's session; over 1.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading higher at Rs 3,629.20 on the NSE, up 0.60% from the previous close, at 10:20 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. In today's session, over 1.5 lakh shares were traded on the NSE.Larsen & Toubro Financial PerformanceHere's a look at the consolidated financial performance of Larsen & Toubro:Quarterly ResultsThe following table shows the consolidated quarterly results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 63,678.92 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,325.57 CroreEPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 63,678.92 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, compared to Rs 3,440.11 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 26.30 for the quarter-ending June 2025, up from Rs 20.26 for the quarter-ending June 2024.Annual ResultsThe following table shows the consolidated annual results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 135,979.03 CroreRs 156,521.23 CroreRs 183,340.70 CroreRs 221,112.91 CroreRs 255,734.45 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,668.96 CroreRs 10,291.05 CroreRs 12,624.87 CroreRs 15,569.72 CroreRs 17,687.39 CroreEPS82.4961.7174.5193.96109.36BVPS625.97678.79736.87746.01710.12ROE15.2610.5211.7215.1215.39Debt to Equity1.731.501.331.321.33The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,734.45 Crore, up from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, compared to Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. With the stock currently trading higher, Larsen & Toubro demonstrates a positive trend in today's session with increase in traded volume.

title: Solar Industries India shares rise 2.13% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Solar Industries India shares gained 2.13% in Monday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 14,770. The stock showed positive movement in the morning session, reflecting a favorable shift in investor sentiment. At 10:18 am, the stock marked a notable increase compared to its previous close. Solar Industries India is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Recent Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Solar Industries India:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,694.78 CroreRs 1,715.83 CroreRs 1,973.08 CroreRs 2,166.55 CroreRs 2,154.45 CroreNet ProfitRs 298.47 CroreRs 298.68 CroreRs 336.54 CroreRs 348.69 CroreRs 352.56 CroreEPS31.6631.5934.8035.6137.43The company has demonstrated consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the last five quarters. Revenue increased from Rs 1,694.78 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 2,154.45 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, net profit rose from Rs 298.47 Crore to Rs 352.56 Crore over the same period. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of Solar Industries India:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,515.63 CroreRs 3,947.61 CroreRs 6,922.53 CroreRs 6,069.52 CroreRs 7,540.26 CroreNet ProfitRs 288.07 CroreRs 455.47 CroreRs 811.44 CroreRs 874.88 CroreRs 1,282.38 CroreEPS30.5448.7783.6892.38133.65BVPS181.45222.64303.94378.70484.68ROE17.4923.0529.0025.2827.57Debt to Equity0.400.450.450.330.21The company's annual revenue has shown a strong growth trajectory, increasing from Rs 2,515.63 Crore in 2021 to Rs 7,540.26 Crore for the year-ending 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, from Rs 288.07 Crore to Rs 1,282.38 Crore over the same period. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased from 0.40 in 2021 to 0.21 in 2025. title: ITC shares show moderate gains in today's session; over 14.5 lakh shares traded
content: ITC shares were trading at Rs 416.30 on the NSE, a 0.43% increase from the previous close at 10:20 am. The traded volume stood at over 14.5 lakh shares in today's session. The company also announced an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) on February 6, 2025, with an effective date of February 12, 2025. ITC had a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Previous bonus issues include: 1:2 on July 1, 2016, 1:1 on August 3, 2010, 1:2 on September 21, 2005, 1:1 on September 12, 1994 and 3:5 on December 12, 1991. Moneycontrol analysis indicated very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 5, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 416.30, ITC demonstrates a moderate increase in today's session, with over 14.5 lakh shares traded.

title: Hitachi Energy India shares rise 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Hitachi Energy India were trading higher in Monday's session, with the stock up 2.07% to Rs 20,715 at 10:12 am. This increase reflects a positive shift from the previous close. Financial Snapshot A review of Hitachi Energy India's financial performance reveals the following: Quarterly Income Statement (Standalone) The company's most recent quarterly results show:Sales for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,478 Crore, compared to Rs 1,883 Crore in March 2025.Other income was Rs 50 Crore in June 2025, down from Rs 38 Crore in March 2025.Total income amounted to Rs 1,529 Crore in June 2025, a decrease from Rs 1,921 Crore in March 2025.Total expenditure was Rs 1,349 Crore in June 2025, down from Rs 1,669 Crore in March 2025.EBIT was Rs 180 Crore in June 2025, compared to Rs 252 Crore in March 2025.Interest expenses were Rs 3 Crore in June 2025, a decrease from Rs 5 Crore in March 2025.Tax expenses totaled Rs 45 Crore in June 2025, down from Rs 62 Crore in March 2025.Net profit stood at Rs 131 Crore in June 2025, compared to Rs 183 Crore in March 2025.Annual Income Statement (Standalone) Key figures from the annual income statement include:Sales for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 6,384 Crore, up from Rs 5,237 Crore in March 2024.Other income increased from Rs 9 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 57 Crore in March 2025.Total income rose to Rs 6,442 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 5,246 Crore in March 2024.Total expenditure increased to Rs 5,880 Crore in March 2025, from Rs 4,978 Crore the previous year.EBIT increased to Rs 561 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 268 Crore in March 2024.Interest expenses decreased slightly to Rs 45 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 46 Crore in March 2024.Tax expenses increased to Rs 132 Crore in March 2025, from Rs 57 Crore in March 2024.Net profit rose to Rs 383 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 163 Crore in March 2024.Balance Sheet (Standalone) The company's balance sheet highlights the following:Share capital remained stable at Rs 8 Crore as of March 2025.Reserves and surplus increased to Rs 4,205 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 1,351 Crore in March 2024.Current liabilities rose to Rs 4,318 Crore in March 2025, from Rs 3,291 Crore in March 2024.Total assets increased to Rs 8,613 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 4,707 Crore in March 2024.Cash Flow (Standalone) The company's cash flow statement indicates:Net cash flow from operating activities was Rs 1,493 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 252 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.Net cash used in investing activities was Rs -109 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, versus Rs -88 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.Net cash flow from financing activities was Rs 2,294 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs -198 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.Financial Ratios (Standalone) Key financial ratios include:Basic and diluted EPS stood at Rs 90.36 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 38.64 for the year-ending March 2024.Book value per share was Rs 944.87 for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 320.72 for the year-ending March 2024.The dividend per share was Rs 6.00 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 4.00 for the year-ending March 2024.The company reported a P/E ratio of 140.04 and a P/B ratio of 13.39 as of March 2025.Corporate Actions Hitachi Energy India announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, which is 300% of face value with effective date as August 13, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bullish sentiment for the stock as of August 11, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 20,715, Hitachi Energy India has demonstrated a positive momentum in today's trading session.

title: Supreme Industries shares rise 2.02% in morning trade, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Supreme Industries gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 4,234.50 in Monday's session. This increase reflects a positive movement compared to the previous close, with the stock showing strong performance in early trading hours. At 10:13 am, the stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Supreme Industries' financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures: Revenue: The company's consolidated revenue shows consistent performance over the recent quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,609.21 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 2,636.35 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2024. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10,446.25 Crore, compared to Rs 10,134.26 Crore for the year-ending March 2024, representing an increase. Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 177.12 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 235.84 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 840.82 Crore, while it was Rs 962.86 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. EPS: The earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 15.93, down from Rs 21.52 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 75.64, compared to Rs 84.21 for the year-ending March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)Mar 20216,357.06832.1577.00Mar 20227,772.82764.0676.24Mar 20239,201.59712.0868.12Mar 202410,134.26962.8684.21Mar 202510,446.25840.8275.64The company’s revenue increased by 3.08% in 2025 compared to 2024. Net profit decreased by 12.67% in 2025 compared to 2024. Key Financial Ratios: Supreme Industries has a book value per share of Rs 445.53 and a return on equity of 16.97% as of the year ending March 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio is 0.00 for the same period. The P/E ratio is 45.30 and P/B is 7.69 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Supreme Industries has a history of corporate actions, including bonus issues, stock splits, and dividend payouts. Recent announcements include the taking charge of the Pipes and Fittings Business in India of Wavin Industries Limited and the commencement of a Long-Term Technology License from Orbia Wavin, announced on August 1, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share with effective date as June 20, 2025. Previously the company announced an interim dividend of Rs 10 per share with effective date as October 30, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis on August 4, 2025, indicated a very bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 4,234.50, Supreme Industries exhibits positive momentum in today's session, supported by its financial performance and strategic corporate actions.
summary_lexrank: The P/E ratio is 45.30 and P/B is 7.69 as of March 2025.
summary_luhn: Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 177.12 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 235.84 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024.

title: Bharat Forge shares rise 2.18% in morning trade
content: Shares of Bharat Forge gained 2.18% to trade at Rs 1,160.00 in Monday's session. At 10:14 am, the stock showcased positive momentum, reflecting investor interest in the counter. Regarding the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.75 Crore, compared to Rs 4,106.15 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 287.14 Crore, up from Rs 173.89 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) was Rs 5.93 in June 2025, compared to Rs 4.36 in June 2024. Here is a detailed look at the company's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,106.15 CroreRs 3,688.51 CroreRs 3,475.55 CroreRs 3,852.60 CroreRs 3,908.75 CroreNet ProfitRs 173.89 CroreRs 243.88 CroreRs 214.32 CroreRs 284.90 CroreRs 287.14 CroreEPSRs 4.36Rs 5.23Rs 4.54Rs 5.92Rs 5.93The consolidated yearly revenue for March 2025 was Rs 15,122.80 Crore, a slight decrease compared to Rs 15,682.07 Crore in March 2024. title: Infosys shares fall 0.41%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Infosys were among the top losers on Nifty 50 in Monday's trading session. At 10:10 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,417.20 on the NSE, a decline of 0.41% from the previous close. Financial Performance: Infosys's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased from Rs 100,472 Crore in 2021 to Rs 162,990 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 19,423 Crore in 2021 to Rs 26,750 Crore in 2025. The company's quarterly performance shows a similar trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, up from Rs 39,315 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period increased from Rs 6,374 Crore to Rs 6,924 Crore. Moneycontrol analysis on August 11, 2025, indicated a very bearish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading among the top losers on the Nifty 50, investor sentiment appears cautious.

title: Manappuram Finance shares fall 3% as brokerages turn cautious on dismal Q1 results
content: Shares of Manappuram Finance fell 3 percent to Rs 251 apiece on August 11 after the company reported weak June quarter (Q1FY26) results. Brokerages stayed in a wait-and-watch mode, with management indicating that the worst phase is over and profitability is expected to return by the fourth quarter of FY26. Jefferies maintained a “hold” call but raised its target price to Rs 275 per share. It said Q1 profit after tax was in line with estimates as weaker net interest income (NII) was offset by lower provisions in the microfinance (MFI) segment. Gold loans grew 12 percent quarter-on-quarter, mainly due to higher prices. However, customer growth was muted despite yield cuts. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The brokerage noted that lower NIMs, unwinding of non-gold loans, and elevated MFI provisions will weigh on earnings. While valuations appear reasonable, Jefferies said more clarity on the turnaround under the new CEO is crucial for a re-rating. CLSA retained its “outperform” rating with a target price of Rs 260 per share. It said Q1FY26 pre-provision operating profit (PPoP) and net profit missed estimates by 9 percent due to sharper-than-expected declines in yields and spreads. Management has trimmed lending rates across high-ticket loans and plans further cuts to around 18 percent over the next four to six quarters. Loan growth of 13 percent quarter-on-quarter was driven entirely by higher ticket sizes, while the Asirvad MFI business saw a 23 percent sequential decline in its loan book. CLSA echoed management’s view that the worst is behind and profitability should return by Q4FY26. In Q1FY26, Manappuram Finance’s net profit fell 75 percent year-on-year to Rs 138 crore from Rs 555 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations declined 9 percent to Rs 2,262 crore. The gold loan segment saw a 10 percent year-on-year rise in revenue to Rs 1,904 crore, but the microfinance segment posted a steep 53 percent drop to Rs 361 crore. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: In Q1FY26, Manappuram Finance’s net profit fell 75 percent year-on-year to Rs 138 crore from Rs 555 crore in the same quarter last year.
summary_luhn: The gold loan segment saw a 10 percent year-on-year rise in revenue to Rs 1,904 crore, but the microfinance segment posted a steep 53 percent drop to Rs 361 crore.
summary_lsa: Shares of Manappuram Finance fell 3 percent to Rs 251 apiece on August 11 after the company reported weak June quarter (Q1FY26) results.
summary_textrank: The gold loan segment saw a 10 percent year-on-year rise in revenue to Rs 1,904 crore, but the microfinance segment posted a steep 53 percent drop to Rs 361 crore.

title: Global Health share price falls 2.22% in early trade
content: Shares of Global Health declined by 2.22% to Rs 1,391.60 in early trade at 9:49 am. Financial Snapshot Global Health's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: The company's sales have shown growth over recent quarters. For the quarter ending June 2025, the sales stood at Rs 882 Crore compared to Rs 611 Crore in June 2024. This represents an increase of 44.35%. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 151 Crore from Rs 96 Crore. Annual Results: The annual revenue for the year 2025 reached Rs 3,692.32 Crore, up from Rs 3,275.11 Crore in 2024. The net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 481.32 Crore in 2025 compared to Rs 478.06 Crore in 2024. title: Gujarat Gas shares rise 2.30% in early trade, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150

title: Tata Motors share price rises 2.61% in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Motors gained 2.61% to trade at Rs 650.25 in early trade. At 9:58 am, the stock witnessed positive movement, driven by overall market sentiments. Here is a summary of the company's recent financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 108,048.00 CroreRs 101,450.00 CroreRs 113,575.00 CroreRs 119,503.00 CroreRs 104,407.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,563.00 CroreRs 3,368.00 CroreRs 5,616.00 CroreRs 8,442.00 CroreRs 3,871.00 CroreEPS14.619.7214.8123.4010.66The consolidated financial performance for the quarter ending June 2025 shows a revenue of Rs 104,407.00 Crore, a decrease compared to the revenue of Rs 119,503.00 Crore in the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 3,871.00 Crore, also lower than the Rs 8,442.00 Crore reported in the previous quarter. The EPS stood at 10.66, down from 23.40 in the previous quarter.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 249,794.75 CroreRs 278,453.62 CroreRs 345,966.96 CroreRs 437,927.77 CroreRs 439,695.00 CroreNet Profit-13,016.14 Crore-11,234.70 CroreRs 2,353.49 CroreRs 31,106.95 CroreRs 22,991.00 CroreEPS-36.99-29.886.2981.9578.80BVPS148.39127.50137.33242.90315.61ROE-24.34-25.675.3236.9723.96Debt to Equity2.083.132.771.160.54The company’s consolidated annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 439,695.00 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 437,927.77 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Net profit decreased from Rs 31,106.95 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 22,991.00 Crore in March 2025. The EPS decreased from 81.95 to 78.80, and the debt-to-equity ratio improved from 1.16 to 0.54. Tata Motors announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of June 4, 2025. Other corporate actions include bonus issues and stock splits. A bonus issue was announced on September 28, 1995, with an existing ratio of 5:3 and an ex-bonus date of October 4, 1995. A stock split was announced on May 26, 2011, with the old face value of Rs 10 split to a new face value of Rs 2, effective September 12, 2011. Tata Motors is currently trading at Rs 650.25, up 2.61% in today's session.
summary_lexrank: A bonus issue was announced on September 28, 1995, with an existing ratio of 5:3 and an ex-bonus date of October 4, 1995.

title: Godrej Industries share price falls 2.02% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Godrej Industries declined by 2.02% to Rs 1,078.40 in early trade on Monday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: Fortis Healthcare shares hit all-time high; stock gains 1.22% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Fortis Healthcare hit an all-time high of Rs 908.95 on the NSE in Monday's early trading session. At 9:40 am, the stock was trading at Rs 908.30, a gain of 1.22% and is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock's new peak reflects strong investor confidence. Financial Snapshot The company's financial performance shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,166.72 Crore, up from Rs 1,858.90 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 263.86 Crore, compared to Rs 173.39 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 2.20 to Rs 3.45. Here is a detailed table of the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,858.90 CroreRs 1,988.39 CroreRs 1,928.26 CroreRs 2,007.20 CroreRs 2,166.72 CroreNet ProfitRs 173.39 CroreRs 188.85 CroreRs 252.24 CroreRs 183.38 CroreRs 263.86 CroreEPS2.202.343.282.443.45The annual consolidated revenue has also shown a strong upward trend. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 7,782.75 Crore, compared to Rs 6,892.92 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit increased from Rs 635.71 Crore to Rs 797.86 Crore, and EPS rose from Rs 7.93 to Rs 10.26. Below is a summary of Fortis Healthcare's annual financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,030.12 CroreRs 5,717.61 CroreRs 6,297.63 CroreRs 6,892.92 CroreRs 7,782.75 CroreNet Profit-103.73 CroreRs 765.80 CroreRs 611.15 CroreRs 635.71 CroreRs 797.86 CroreEPS-1.457.357.807.9310.26BVPS88.9892.83107.30113.33118.11ROE-1.798.988.127.818.68Debt to Equity0.190.160.100.110.25The income statement provides further insights into the company’s financial health. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 7,782 Crore, compared to Rs 6,892 Crore in the previous year. Total income increased to Rs 7,849 Crore from Rs 6,931 Crore. EBIT stood at Rs 1,179 Crore, and after accounting for interest and taxes, the net profit was Rs 797 Crore. Key financial ratios for Fortis Healthcare as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 68.07 and a P/B ratio of 5.91. The company's debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.25 for the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Fortis Healthcare has announced several corporate actions. On August 7, 2025, the company disclosed information regarding analyst/investor meets and newspaper publications. Additionally, there was an announcement on August 6, 2025, concerning a change in management with the re-appointment of a Tax Auditor. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (10%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. Similar dividends were announced in May 2023 and May 2024. Fortis Healthcare's stock is currently trading near its all-time high, driven by strong financial performance and positive investor sentiment.

title: Suzlon Energy, Hitachi Energy stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in today's trading session
content: Several stocks are exhibiting notable activity in today's session. At 9:30 am, Suzlon Energy shares are trading at Rs 64.44, reflecting a 1.07% increase. This performance places Suzlon Energy among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Hitachi Energy shares are also among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150, trading at Rs 20,465.00, up by 0.90%. Shares of Mazagon are trading at Rs 2,682.70, gaining 0.89%. Suzlon Energy Financial Highlights Suzlon Energy's financial performance reveals a positive trend in both quarterly and yearly results. The company's consolidated revenue has increased consistently over the past few quarters, reaching Rs 3,789.94 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, compared to Rs 2,196.21 Crore in the quarter ending March 2024. Net profit has also seen a significant rise, with Rs 1,180.98 Crore reported for the quarter ending March 2025, a substantial increase from Rs 254.12 Crore in the same quarter last year. On an annual basis, the consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 10,889.74 Crore, up from Rs 6,529.09 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased from Rs 660.35 Crore in 2024 to Rs 2,071.63 Crore in 2025. Furthermore, net profit saw a substantial increase of 213.72%, climbing from Rs 660.35 Crore in 2024 to Rs 2,071.63 Crore in 2025. With the stock currently priced at Rs 64.44, Suzlon Energy has demonstrated a notable upward trend in today's trading session, positioning it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Asian Paints share price falls 0.65%, stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: In Monday's early trading session, Asian Paints was trading at Rs 2,459.60, a decline of 0.65% and among the top losers on Nifty 50. ICICI Bank, Apollo Hospital, Bajaj Finserv, and Adani Ports were also among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. The quarterly revenue for Asian Paints shows a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 8,969.73 Crore, which then decreased to Rs 8,027.54 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It increased to Rs 8,549.44 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, and further decreased to Rs 8,358.91 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The most recent quarter, ending June 2025, shows a revenue of Rs 8,938.55 Crore. Net profit also followed a fluctuating pattern. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 1,150.07 Crore, which decreased to Rs 662.54 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It then increased to Rs 1,078.61 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, before decreasing again to Rs 677.78 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The latest quarter, ending June 2025, shows a net profit of Rs 1,080.73 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) mirrored this trend. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 12.20, which decreased to Rs 7.25 for the quarter-ending September 2024. It increased to Rs 11.58 for the quarter-ending December 2024, and then decreased to Rs 7.22 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The quarter-ending June 2025, shows an EPS of Rs 11.47.ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 8,969.73 CroreRs 8,027.54 CroreRs 8,549.44 CroreRs 8,358.91 CroreRs 8,938.55 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,150.07 CroreRs 662.54 CroreRs 1,078.61 CroreRs 677.78 CroreRs 1,080.73 CroreEPS12.207.2511.587.2211.47The yearly financial performance of Asian Paints reveals consistent growth in revenue from 2021 to 2025, although there was a slight dip in 2025. Revenue increased from Rs 21,712.79 Crore in 2021 to Rs 35,494.73 Crore in 2024, before decreasing to Rs 33,905.62 Crore in 2025. Net profit showed a similar trend, increasing from Rs 3,178.15 Crore in 2021 to Rs 5,424.69 Crore in 2024, and then decreasing to Rs 3,569.00 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also followed this pattern, rising from Rs 32.73 in 2021 to Rs 56.95 in 2024, before decreasing to Rs 38.25 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has shown consistent growth from 2021 to 2025, increasing from Rs 137.92 in 2021 to Rs 202.25 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) increased from 24.51% in 2021 to 29.15% in 2024, before decreasing to 18.90% in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio has remained relatively stable, fluctuating between 0.03 and 0.06 over the years.Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 21,712.79 CroreRs 29,101.28 CroreRs 34,488.59 CroreRs 35,494.73 CroreRs 33,905.62 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,178.15 CroreRs 3,053.24 CroreRs 4,101.48 CroreRs 5,424.69 CroreRs 3,569.00 CroreEPS32.7331.5942.8356.9538.25BVPS137.92148.03171.45195.25202.25ROE (%)24.5121.9425.6729.1518.90Debt to Equity0.030.060.060.060.04Asian Paints announced several corporate actions. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 20.55 per share (2055%) on May 8, 2025, with the effective date being June 10, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 4.25 per share (425%) was announced on September 17, 2024, with the effective date of November 19, 2024. On August 6, 2025, Asian Paints, through its representatives, announced participation in meetings, as per the enclosed letter. With the stock currently trading lower, Asian Paints is exhibiting bearish sentiment in today's session.

title: Suzlon Energy shares rise 2.12% in early trade
content: Shares of Suzlon Energy gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 64.53 in early trade. At 9:27 am, the stock showed positive movement on Monday's session. Suzlon Energy is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Quarterly Performance: The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 stood at Rs 2,196.21 Crore. In the following quarters, the revenue was Rs 2,021.59 Crore for June 2024, Rs 2,103.38 Crore for September 2024, Rs 2,974.83 Crore for December 2024, and Rs 3,789.94 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same periods was Rs 254.12 Crore, Rs 302.29 Crore, Rs 200.60 Crore, Rs 387.76 Crore, and Rs 1,180.98 Crore, respectively. The earnings per share (EPS) were Rs 0.19, Rs 0.22, Rs 0.15, Rs 0.28, and Rs 0.87 for the corresponding quarters.HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,196.21 CroreRs 2,021.59 CroreRs 2,103.38 CroreRs 2,974.83 CroreRs 3,789.94 CroreNet ProfitRs 254.12 CroreRs 302.29 CroreRs 200.60 CroreRs 387.76 CroreRs 1,180.98 CroreEPS0.190.220.150.280.87Annual Performance: The company's consolidated annual revenue has shown significant growth. The revenue for the year 2021 was Rs 3,345.72 Crore. It increased to Rs 6,581.78 Crore in 2022, then slightly decreased to Rs 5,970.53 Crore in 2023, before rising to Rs 6,529.09 Crore in 2024 and further to Rs 10,889.74 Crore for the year 2025. The net profit also experienced considerable changes, with Rs 100.34 Crore in 2021, a loss of Rs -166.19 Crore in 2022, a substantial profit of Rs 2,887.29 Crore in 2023, Rs 660.35 Crore in 2024, and Rs 2,071.63 Crore in 2025. The EPS figures reflect this volatility, with Rs 0.14 in 2021, Rs -0.22 in 2022, Rs 2.64 in 2023, Rs 0.50 in 2024, and Rs 1.52 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,345.72 CroreRs 6,581.78 CroreRs 5,970.53 CroreRs 6,529.09 CroreRs 10,889.74 CroreNet ProfitRs 100.34 CroreRs -166.19 CroreRs 2,887.29 CroreRs 660.35 CroreRs 2,071.63 CroreEPS0.14-0.222.640.501.52BVPS-4.12-3.880.902.884.47ROE-3.020.00259.2016.8433.92Debt to Equity-1.23-1.181.730.030.05Income Statement (Annual): The annual sales figures show a similar trend, increasing from Rs 3,345 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 10,889 Crore in March 2025. Total income rose from Rs 3,365 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 10,993 Crore in March 2025. The total expenditure also increased significantly, from Rs 2,264 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 9,291 Crore in March 2025. title: Nifty 50 Top Gainers: Grasim, SBI, Adani Enterprises, Trent stocks lead index in today's session
content: At 9:25 am, Monday's session saw Grasim leading the gains on the Nifty 50, trading at Rs 2,748.50, a rise of 2.11%. SBI followed with a 1.49% increase, trading at Rs 816.30. Adani Enterpris also showed a positive trend, trading at Rs 2,200.90, marking a 1.05% gain. NTPC and Trent also recorded increases of 1.02% and 0.78% respectively. Here's a look at the financial performance of the mentioned companies:GrasimGrasim's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: For the quarter-ending June 2025, Grasim reported a revenue of Rs 40,118.08 Crore, up from Rs 33,860.75 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 2,698.41 Crore, compared to Rs 2,235.67 Crore in the previous year. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 148,477.89 Crore, an increase from Rs 130,978.48 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,459.54 Crore, a decrease from Rs 9,836.97 Crore in the previous year. Key financial ratios for Grasim as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 46.99 and a P/B ratio of 1.82. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.88 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)76,397.8195,701.13117,627.08130,978.48148,477.89Net Profit (Rs Crore)6,560.0210,310.2210,869.249,836.977,459.54EPS65.57114.98103.9885.2955.57BVPS1,558.521,764.721,866.801,335.131,432.80ROE6.579.978.676.343.80Debt to Equity0.950.961.291.521.88Adani EnterprisesAdani Enterprises' consolidated financial performance reveals the following: For the quarter-ending June 2025, Adani Enterpris reported a revenue of Rs 21,961.20 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 25,472.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 895.03 Crore, down from Rs 1,648.20 Crore in the previous year. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 97,894.75 Crore, an increase from Rs 96,420.98 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,510.22 Crore, an increase from Rs 3,293.40 Crore in the previous year. Key financial ratios for Adani Enterpris as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 38.25 and a P/B ratio of 5.62. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.09 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)2,592.964,498.028,242.0212,375.1117,134.61Net Profit (Rs Crore)-109.7729.46310.221,353.891,447.91EPS-4.112.9812.5141.8243.51BVPS66.3267.7974.91115.40153.64ROE-6.314.4717.1336.5528.31Debt to Equity0.000.210.190.120.09Grasim announced a final dividend of Rs 10 per share, with an effective date of August 12, 2025. Historically, the company split its shares on October 6, 2016, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 2. SBI announced a final dividend of Rs 15.90 per share, with an effective date of May 16, 2025. The company had a stock split on November 20, 2014, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 1. Adani Enterpris announced a final dividend of Rs 1.30 per share, with an effective date of June 13, 2025. The company had a stock split on July 28, 2004, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 1. NTPC announced an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share, with an effective date of January 31, 2025. Trent announced a final dividend of Rs 5 per share, with an effective date of June 12, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 12, 2016, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 1. The initial trading session of Monday saw positive movements among the Nifty 50's top gainers, supported by recent financial results and corporate actions.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls marginally in early trade
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading at Rs 1,852.10 on the NSE, a decline of 0.35 percent in early trade. Financial Snapshot The following table summarizes the key consolidated financial figures for Bharti Airtel:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26The company has shown consistent revenue growth over the quarters. Specifically, the revenue increased from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. The net profit, however, experienced fluctuations, with a significant increase in December 2024 and March 2025 before declining in June 2025. title: ITC shares gain marginally in early trade
content: In Monday's early trading session, ITC shares were trading at Rs 415.35 on the NSE, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.21% from the previous close. At 9:20 am, the stock showed positive movement, contributing to the overall market activity. Financial Performance: ITC's financial performance reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Results: For the quarter ending June 2025, ITC reported a revenue of Rs 21,494.79 Crore and a net profit of Rs 5,274.65 Crore. In comparison, the quarter ending June 2024 showed a revenue of Rs 18,457.33 Crore and a net profit of Rs 5,169.37 Crore. final dividend of Rs 34 per share (1700%) on May 08, 2025, with an effective date of June 03, 2025. The company had earlier announced a final dividend of Rs 28 per share on May 08, 2024. The company has also announced multiple bonus issues in the past, including a 1:2 bonus on July 13, 2017, and another 1:2 bonus on July 11, 2013.
